loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, de 25 años de edad, es una joven mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, con muchos deseos de salir adelante a base de su propio esfuerzo. Es madre soltera de un hijo llamado Jockmer de 6 años de edad. Juntos viven en su propia casa que logró comprar con su ex pareja antes de separase. La actividad que realiza es la venta de comidas, refrescos, hamburguesas, pasteles, que es receta de casa. Todas la preparaciones las realiza en la casa de su madre pues le queda más cerca de su puesto de venta, además entrega prensión a los trabajadores una obra de construcción de un colegio teniendo 25 pedidos diarios, que le generan un ingreso fijo y constante. Se inició con un préstamo de su hermana quien también se dedica a éste negocio y la animó haciéndole ver las ganancias que le deja, entonces empezó preparando en pocas cantidades con cierto temor al principio pero luego viendo que terminaba toda su comida, decidió continuar con su negocio.
Comenta que se encontraba en apuros económicos ya elle es padre y madre para su hijo, quien necesita de alimentación y educación,  viendo ésta necesidad buscaba un oficio para generarse un sustento.
Entonces ahora teniendo buenas ganancias, desea prosperar y en un futuro abrir otro negocio de librería en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero, de esa manera se sentirá  más segura de avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una unidad de transporte conocido como mototaxi de segundo uso, valorizado en 2000 nuevos soles de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de transporte para la entrega de los menús a sus pensionados, y con el saldo, ingredientes para la preparación de comidas.
texts.en:
25-year-old Susana is a determined and hard-working young woman who has a great desire to make progress in life through her own efforts.  She is a single mother and has a 6-year-old son called Jockmer.  They live together in their own home which Susana bought together with her ex-partner before they separated.  

Susana's business is selling meals, soft drinks, hamburgers and pies which she makes to her own recipe.  She prepares all her food in her mother's house as it is closer to her sales location.  She also provides lunches to workers on a construction site at a school which makes her 25 orders a day.  This gives her a regular, fixed income.  She started her business with a loan from her sister who also works in this trade and who encouraged her, showing her the profits that the business makes.  She started off preparing her food in small quantities, with a certain amount of trepidation at first, but when she saw how she was managing to sell all the food she prepared, she decided to keep going.  She says that she has been in some financial tight spots in the past as she is both mother and father to her son who needs food and an education.  Given this need, she looked for a trade that would make enough to support him.  Now that she is making good profits, Susana would like her business to thrive and, in the future, she would like to open another business (a stationery store) in her home.

This will be Susana's fifth loan from MFP.  She feels grateful to know that she will have financial support as this makes her feel more certain that she will achieve her goals.  She feels happy to be a member of her community bank as she believes it to be a united and supportive group.  Susana will use the 3,000 soles that she has requested to invest in buying a vehicle.  She will buy a second-hand motorcycle taxi (which costs 2,000 soles).  This will save her having to pay for transportation when she delivers her meals to her diners.  She will use the remaining money to buy ingredients for preparing her food.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi and ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 33 years old and is the mother of 2 children. She does maize farming to earn a living. Hellen has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Hellen has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nafeth

texts.en:
Nafeth is a 53-year-old man who is a father with two sons and two daughters. For the past five years, Nafeth has been a taxi driver who receives a low income insufficient for covering the family's costs.

Nafeth is requesting a 3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the expenses of making some repairs to the taxi such as painting, changing the window glass, and replacing the engine with a new one. This loan will increase the taxi's efficiency and enable Nafeth to take more internal and external requests, increasing his income and improving the family's living condition.

Nafeth is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: To repair the taxi and change the engine

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. Susan has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Susan has been able to educate her children and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan of  20,000 Kenya Shilling to buy maize flour, sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell

loans.name: Nasrin's Group

texts.en:
Nasrin is a 36-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of 3 children. For the past 4 years, she has been working from her home, using her sewing skills to help support her family.

In the past, Nasrin – as member of a group – has successfully applied, received and repaid a Relief International Microfinance Iraq loan which she used to improve her work area.

Nasrin now took a new loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine, fabric and raw materials. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Shoxan's Group

texts.en:
Shoxan is a 27-year-old, married Iraqi woman. For the past 5 years, she has been working from her home, using her sewing skills to help support her family by working on custom ordered dresses. 

Shoxan took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine and an iron and improve her work area with some small furniture items. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, an iron and improve her work area with some small furniture items.

loans.name: Heshw's Group

texts.en:
Heshw is a traditional, shy, young Iraqi wife and a mother of one child. For the past 3 years, she has been working from her home, using her sewing skills to help support her family by working on custom ordered dresses. 

Heshw took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine and improve her work area with some small furniture items. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and improve her work area with some small furniture items.

loans.name: Zhyan's Group

texts.en:
Zhyan is a 43-year-old Iraqi woman, a wife and a mother of four children. Working from her home, she has been using her sewing skills for the past 5 years to participate in financially supporting her family.

In the past, Zhyan – as member of this same group - successfully applied for, received and repaid a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq which she used to buy a small generator allowing her to work even during the hours the city lacks power. 

Now, Zhyan took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to improve her work area.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her work area.

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noe, de 58 años de edad, es un hombre decidido y empeñoso, además de ser alegre y amable. Esta casado con Rosa quien es docente  madre de  sus hijos Grely de 30, Saulo de 28 quien es discapacitado y  Juan de 21 años de edad. Juntos viven en su casa propia casa en la compañía de su sobrino  Omar quien también es discapacitado. La actividad que realiza Noe es la venta de agua y el servicio de lavado de motos, para eso tiene un espacio acondicionado en su casa donde atiende a sus clientes brindándoles un servicio rápido, pero está cerrado por una semana ya que la Municipalidad  está realizando arreglos en la calle.  
Se inicio hace más de 9 años con un préstamo bancario y hasta el momento le apoyan sus hijos en la atención a los clientes. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y la continua visita de sus clientes. Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de contar con un oficio ya que no lograba conseguir trabajo y vio la oportunidad de negocio por  la ubicación de  su casa. 
Ahora se siente más tranquilo económicamente y tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, abriendo una librería en su casa ya que están ubicados cerca de un colegio. Este será el préstamo número 3 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de un mototaxi de segundo uso para alquilarlo  valorizado en 2300 nuevos soles y con el saldo realizar arreglos en su lavadero para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Noe is 58 years old.  He is a determined and hardworking man who is also happy and friendly.  He is married to Rosa, who is a teacher.  Their children are Grely, 30 years old, Saulo, 28, who is disabled, and Juan, who is 21 years old.  They live together in their own house along with his nephew Omar, who is also disabled.  

Noe works selling water and washing cars.  He has a space set up in his house where he attends to his customers, giving them fast service.  He is closed for a week because the town is making repairs to the street.  He started his business more than nine years ago with a bank loan.  His children help him service the customers.  He considers his business to be profitable because of the income he earns and the continued visits of his customers.  He decided to start his business so that he had a job since he was not successful at finding work, and he saw the opportunity based on the location of his house.

Now he feels more comfortable economically and has plans to expand his business, for example opening a bookstore in his house since it is located close to a high school.  This is his third loan with MFP and he hopes their collaboration will continue so he can meet his objectives.  With a loan of 3000 nuevos soles, he will purchase a used mototaxi for 2300 nuevos soles so that he can rent it out.  With the rest of the loan, he will make repairs to his car wash to offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve washing cars and to purchase a mototaxi.

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es:
Gisela, de 32 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, le gusta los negocios que aprendió de sus padres, además de ser amable y cordial. Es conviviente con Horacio quien es comerciante y padre sus 2  hijos, Chaline de 12 y Alison de 5 años de edad. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron  a base de mucho esfuerzo y dedicación. 
La actividad que realiza Gisela es la venta de zapatos femeninos que compra por catálogo a precios cómodos. También vende ropas variadas siendo lo último en la moda para damas, caballeros y niños que compra en sus viajes a la capital. Todos estos productos los vende desde su casa entre sus amistades, vecinos y familiares al contado y otras veces en crédito pagadero hasta en 20 días, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial logrando ganarse sus preferencias.  
 Se inicio  hace más de 5 años con un capital propio y la idea de una amiga quien le animo a dedicarse a la venta y hasta el momento le ayuda su hermana en conseguir nuevos clientes en su centro de labores en una entidad pública.  
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos logrando acabar toda la ropa que trae.
Antes de tener esta actividad no tenía problemas, pero teniendo muchas ganas de generarse sus propios ingresos y no depender solamente de los ingresos de su pareja. 
Entonces viendo los buenos resultados que tiene con su negocio, espera aumentar su stock de su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que tendrá para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en los créditos anteriores. Además  comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con le monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de zapatos femeninos  a la moda de catalogo, así tendrá un stock disponible para la venta y vera crecer sus negocio. Buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
32-year-old Gisela is a woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She is also very kind and friendly.  Gisela lives with Horacio who is a salesman and the father of her two children, 12-year-old Chaline and 5-year-old Alison.  They live comfortably together in their own home which they worked very hard to buy.

Gisela's business is selling women's shoes that she buys through a catalog at affordable prices.  She also sells a range of clothing.  She sells the latest fashions for women, men and children and stocks up during her trips to the capital.  She sells all of her products from home to her friends, neighbors and family members.  She sells for cash and sometimes offers credit for up to 20 days.  She serves her customers in a kind and friendly manner which earns her their loyalty.

Gisela started her business five years ago with her own capital.  She got the idea from a friend who encouraged her to start selling.  Her sister helps her to attract new customers at her job, working for a public institution.

Gisela considers her business to be fairly profitable because of the money she makes and the demand that she has for her products.  She manages to sell all the clothing that she brings back from the capital.  Gisela did not have any problems before she started her business but she was really keen to make her own money and not depend solely on her partner's income.

Given the good results that she has experienced in her business, Gisela hopes to increase her stock of merchandise so that she can watch her business grow.  This will be her fourth loan from MFP.  She feels happy that she will have financial support in making progress in her business.  For this reason, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loans.  She says that she is happy with her community bank because it is a united and supportive group.  Gisela will use the 3,000 soles she has requested to buy fashionable women's shoes from her catalog so that she has stock available to sell.  This will allow her to grow her business.  She will buy at lower prices because she will be buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Sarli

texts.es:
Sarli, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Edson quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus hijos gemelos de 4 años de edad a quienes quieren mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compraron con muchos esfuerzos. La actividad que realiza Sarli es la venta de pollos beneficiados, para eso se levanta todos los días muy de temprano y se dirige a los puertos donde llegan los productores de los caseríos y les compra a precios por mayor, luego los lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado donde los vende al menudeo, generalmente logrando vender todo lo que lleva en las mañanas. Y en las tardes vende golosinas en un tablero que instala en el frontis de su casa, siendo sus clientes sus propios vecinos.
Se inició en éste negocio hace más de 1 año con un capital propio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja que le han servido para solventar los gastos de su hogar. Se decidió empezar con éste negocio pues antes no contaba con ingresos propios y los de su pareja muchas veces no les alcanzaba, entonces viendo esta dificultad decidió apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar y así brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Ahora observando los buenos resultados que está teniendo, tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio que ha visto ser rentable que es la venta de ropa. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida al saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para continuar con su negocio. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, por el apoyo que vienen dando la personas con negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio, ósea pollos en mayor cantidad, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen, así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Sarli is 29 years old. She is a hardworking and dedicated woman, in addition to being cheerful and sociable. She lives with Edson, who works in transportation and is the father of her 4 year old twin daughters, whom they love very much. Together they live comfortably in their own home that they bought with much effort. Sarli's activity is selling chickens. To do this, she gets up very early every day and goes to where the the farmers from the surrounding towns go and she buys from them wholesale. Later she takes them to sell in the market where she sells them retail, generally selling everything she has in the morning. In the afternoon she sells snacks from a table in front of her house. Her customers are her own neighbors.  

She started this business more than a year ago with her own capital, and so far she does the work alone. She considers her business to be very profitable because it leaves her with good earnings and has helped her pay for her household expenses. She decided to start this business because before she didn't have her own income and her spouse' many times wasn't enough. Facing this difficulty, she decided to help him pay for the household expenses and in that way offer her daughters a better quality of life.  

Now after seeing the good results that she is getting, she has plans to go into another business that she has seen is profitable, selling clothes. This will be loan number 2 with the MFP institution. She is grateful to know that she can count on financial support to continue her business. In addition she is happy with her communal bank, for the support they have given to people with businesses.

With the 1000 nuevos soles she has asked for, she will invest in buying merchandise for her business, that is, a greater quantity of chickens, seeking good prices for her purchases in volume, thus making more profit.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to sell their meat.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa, de 49 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es conviviente con Ronald quien es empleado y padre de sus hijos, que en su mayoría ya son independientes. Juntos  están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de su hijo menor Luis de 12 años de edad. La actividad que realiza Teresa es la venta de comidas por las noches como juanes, pescados asados, tallarines y otros. Para eso instalará una mesa en el frontis de su casa donde atenderá muy amablemente a todos sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes de la zona. 
Está retomando éste negocio pues lo había dejado por problemas personales, ahora consiguiendo los implementos necesarios como platos, ollas y otros piensa realizarlo sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene ya que en su zona es muy conocida y solicitada, siendo sus vecinas quienes le piden que retome su negocio. 
Por otro lado, ella comenta que tiene problemas económicos pues con los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, por tanto quiere apoyarlo generándose un ingreso adicional.
Por tanto, viendo lo rentable que es su negocio, y los pedidos que tiene, desea empezar y continuar hasta hacerlo crecer y en un futuro poder abrir un restaurante ya que le gusta la cocina. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar  sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen dando las personas con el acceso a créditos. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios para su negocio como ollas, vasos, platos, y otros, además de mesas y sillas, también ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas buscando precios bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
49-year-old Teresa is a woman who has a great desire to do well and provide her family with a better quality of life.  She lives with Ronald who is an employee and the father of her children.  Most of her children are now independent.  Teresa and her husband live comfortably together in their own home together with their youngest son Luis who is 12 years old.

Teresa's business is selling food in the evenings such as 'juanes' (a traditional chicken dish), grilled fish, noodles, etc.  She sets up a table in front of her home and serves all of her customers with a lot of kindness.  Her customers are mainly her neighbors and passersby.  She is re-starting this business after she had left if owing to some personal problems.  She is now acquiring the equipment she needs to re-start her business such as plates, pans, etc.  She will work alone.

Teresa considers her business to be fairy profitable because of the demand she has.  She is very well-known in her area and her food is popular.  It was her neighbors who asked her to re-start her business.  Teresa says that she has financial problems because her partner's income isn't enough to cover all their expenses.  This is why she wants to support him with this additional income.  Given how profitable her business is and the orders she has, she would like to start again and continue working so that she can grow her business and, in the future, open a restaurant because she enjoys cooking.

This will be Teresa's fifth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support in carrying out her plans.  She pledges to be responsible in making her loan repayments as she was with her previous loans.  She says that she is very happy to belong to her community bank because of the support that they give to people through access to loans.  Teresa will invest the 1,500 soles she has requested in buying equipment for her business such as pans, glasses and plates.  She will also buy tables, chairs, and ingredients she needs for preparing her meals.  She will buy at low prices because she will be buying for cash and in bulk.

loans.use: to buy pans, glasses, plates, tables, chairs and ingredients so that she can prepare more food

loans.name: Mhabad's Group

texts.en:
Mhabad is a conservative 49-year-old Iraqi woman, a wife and a mother of five children. Like many Iraqi women, she learned to sew at a young age. She has been using her sewing skills for the past five years to participate in financially supporting her family.

Working from her home, Mhabad has been using an old sewing machine. She now took a loan from Relief International-Microfinance Iraq to buy a new machine and improve her work area with some small furniture items and an iron.

Relief International-Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and improve her work area with some small furniture items and an iron.

loans.name: Dara

texts.en:
When one visits Dara, one visits a truly sweet spot in Iraq. The smell of vanilla, baked honey, caramel, cream, and fresh pastry are all signs of being in the Middle East, and being in for a great treat. 

Dara is married and has two children who are learning, from the example their father sets, the meaning of hard work behind the sweets joys of life. 

Dara has been running his sweets shop for four years. He took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 3,000 USD to purchase a new mixer and ingredients to expand his selection.

loans.use: to purchase a new mixer and ingredients to expand his selection.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith, de 46 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial, le gusta los negocios. Es conviviente con Osias quien es empleado y padre sus hijos Janis de 16 años de edad y Galicia de 20 años quien tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Judith es la venta de panes, quesos y jamonadas, para eso tiene 2  puestos de venta en el mercado donde le ayuda su hija atendiendo en uno de los ellos. Su actividad empieza todos los días por las mañanas, se dirige a su puesto a recibir su mercadería que le entregan sus proveedores de panes y quesos, para luego venderlos durante la mañana, logrando acabar toda su mercadería, gracias a que brinda una buena atención a sus clientes sabiendo que así volverán a comprarle al día siguiente.
Se inició hace más de 4 años con un préstamo particular y comprando en pequeñas cantidades fue haciendo rotar su capital y viendo la acogida que tuvo, decidió continuar logrando crecer y expandirse.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la salida de sus productos es constante y diaria, logrando acabar todo lo que oferta en las mañanas.
Por otro lado comenta se decidió en iniciar su negocio por el bienestar de su familia, buscando brindar una mejor calidad de vida y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Por tanto, y viendo los buenos resultados que sigue teniendo, desea continuar con su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que seguirá teniendo el apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a ser puntual con el pago sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además de gustarle el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene brindando a las personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra otro puesto de venta para incursionar en la venta de jugos de frutas y desayunos, brindando un trabajo a su nuera.
texts.en:
Judith is 46 years old and is a hardworking and dedicated woman, in addition to being friendly and polite. She likes business. She lives with Osias, who is an employee and the father of her children, Janis,16, and  Galicia, 20, who has a 4 year old and a 1 year old. They live together comfortably in their own home that they bought with much effort. Her activity is selling bread, cheese and ham. To do this she has 2 sales locales in the market, where her daughter helps her by working at one of them. Her activity begins every morning by going to her locale to receive the merchandise the suppliers deliver, bread and cheese. She then sells them all morning and is able to sell out of all of her merchandise thanks to the good service she gives her customers, knowing they will buy again from her the next day. 

She started more than 4 years ago with a private loan and by buying small quantities. She rotated her capital and seeing how people liked what she was doing, she decided to continue growing and expanding. She considers her business to be very profitable because it earns her good income and her products go out constantly every day and she runs out every morning. She remarks that she decided to open her business for her family's wellbeing, seeking to offer them a better quality of life and to help her spouse with the household expenses.  

Therefore, seeing the good results that she keeps getting, she wants to continue with her business. This will be loan number 5 with the MFP institution. She is happy to know that she will continue to have the financial support to continue with her plans. She is committed to making her payments on time as she did with previous loans. She also likes the work her communal bank has done supporting people.

With the 2000 nuevos soles she has asked for, she will invest in buying another locale to go into selling fruit juice and breakfasts, offering a job to her daughter in law.

loans.use: to buy a sales locale and sell fruit juice and breakfasts.

loans.name: Dulia

texts.es:
Dulia, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, decidida y amable. Es separada del padre de sus 2 hijos Yuber y Yanela de 6 y 4 años de edad respectivamente. Viven en su propia casa en compañía de sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Dulia es la venta de comida, especialmente desayunos y menús. Los cuales entrega en forma de pensión a sus clientes que laboran en una construcción civil de un colegio contando con 40 clientes fijos tanto para desayunos y almuerzos lo que permite tener un ingreso fijo y constante. Todas las preparaciones las realiza en la casa de su tía que le queda más cerca de la obra. Se inició hace más de 3 años con un capital propio, al principio lo realizaba sola, pero viendo crecer su negocio necesito ayuda que le brinda sus tía y prima, con quienes comparte sus ganancias. Comenta que decidió iniciarse en éste negocio por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para mantener a sus hijos ya que se había separado de su pareja y no contaba con apoyo.
Pero gracias a sus esfuerzos  a logrado hacer crecer sus ingresos, ahora con las ganancias desea terminar de construir su casa  y hacer ampliar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 1 con la institución MFP. Se siente agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, de esa manera se sentirá más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta gustarle el trabajo de su banco comunal por el apoyo que viene brindando a las personas con sus negocios. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus comidas, como arroz, azúcar, aceites y otros, al por mayor, así tener un stock disponible, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
26-year-old Dulia is a hard-working, kind, determined woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She is separated from the father of her two children Yuber and Yanela who are 6 and 4.  She lives together in her own home with her children who she loves very much.  

Dulia's business is selling food, especially breakfasts and lunches.  She delivers these meals to her customers who work on a construction site at a school.  She has 40 regular customers for her breakfasts and her lunches.  This makes her a fixed, regular income.  She makes all of her food in her aunt's home as it is nearer the construction site.  She started her business three years ago with her own capital.  At first she worked alone but as she saw her business grow she needed help.  She has help from her aunt and cousin and shares her profits with them.  She says that she decided to start out in this business because she needed an income to provide for her children as she had separated from her partner and didn't have any support.

Thanks to her hard work, Dulia has managed to increase her income.  She would now like to use her profits to finish building her home and expand her business.  This will be her first loan from MFP.  She feels grateful for the financial support that she will receive as she feels more certain of making progress in her business.  Dulia will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying the ingredients she needs for preparing her meals such as rice, sugar, oil, etc.  She will buy these products wholesale and thereby have stock available.  She will look to buy her products at affordable prices because she will be buying in bulk.  This will make her more profits.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 30 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Ernesto de 32 años y sus 04 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindar un buen futuro. Yolanda, es una mujer de lucro se dedica al negocio, su propósito es estar junto a su familia  sin descuidar los deberes. Hace 13 años logró abrir su tienda de abarrotes  en la cual le resulta muy bien con las ventas que realiza, ya que sus principales clientes son sus vecinos cercanos a ella. Yolanda, comenta que hay ventajas y desventajas en su labor; por lo cual tiene que afrontar y seguir adelante con las ventas de su negocio para sobresalir en los gastos económicos. Desde que empezó a solicitar el préstamo de MFP ahora su negocio le va muy bien ya que de esa manera puede seguir con sus planes de trabajo. Este será su crédito número 07 con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente en sus pagos respectivos, además le va de la mejora manera en su grupo comunal.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará mercadería, para así abastecer a su bodega, con el propósito de captar más clientes.
texts.en:
30-year-old Yolanda lives in her own house together with her 32-year-old husband Ernesto and their 4 dear children whom they want to provide with a good future. Yolanda is a profitable business woman. Her intention is to be together with her family without neglecting her duties. 13 years ago she succeeded in opening a grocery store, which has turned out very well with the sales that she makes, since her principal customers are her nearby neighbors. Yolanda comments that there are advantages and disadvantages to her work. Therefore, she has to face things and continue making progress with her business sales so she can stay on top of the economic costs. Ever since she started requesting the MFP loans, her business has been going very well for her, since in this way she has been able to continue with her work plans. This will be her 7th loan with MFP, so she assures that she will faithfully meet her respective payments. In addition, things go really well for her in her communal group.
With the 1000 new Peruvian soles, she will buy merchandise to stock her shop, with the goal of attracting more customers.

loans.use: to buy staple goods with which to stock her store.

loans.name: Jolnar

texts.en:
Jolnar, age 34, is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. They have two sons and one daughter.

Jolnar's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary, enough to cover the family's needs but not to pay for improving the condition of the family home. For this reason, Jolnar is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the expenses of installing new windows and doors instead of the very old ones currently in place. This will improve the family house's condition and offer better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to pay for installing new doors and windows in the family home in order to improve the house's condition

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La señora francisca, originaria de la comarca el Coyolito, la Concordia municipio de Jinotega, de oficio comerciante dueña  de una Pulpería. Nos comenta  que su crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda, pues pudo surtir su negocio, ofreció nuevos productos,  su clientela ha ido aumentando poco a poco, sintió muy positivo el préstamo Kiva en su negocio y por el cual esta muy agradecida. 
Ella esta solicitando un crédito para compra de artículo escolares, granos básicos, enlatados, productos de limpieza, aceite, sopas, avenas, leche, queso, huevo, pan, verduras, pollo carne. Este crédito le ayudara a ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes lo que le favorece a sus ventas de comestibles. Pues su sueño es convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora y sobre todo que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en: Francisca is from Coyolito in the Concordia area of Jinotega, Nicaragua. She is the owner of a convenience store. She tells us that her last loan helped her greatly in enabling her to stock up her shop, offer new products and, little by little, increase her customer base. The loan from Kiva has had very positive effects on her business, which she is very grateful for. She is asking for this loan to buy school items, basic grains, tinned foods, cleaning products, oil, soap, oats, milk, cheese, eggs, bread, vegetables, chicken and meat. This loan will helps her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, which is good for her sales. Her dream is to turn her store into a wholesaler, and, above all, to give her children the opportunity to study.

loans.use: para compra de artículo escolares, granos básicos, enlatados, productos de limpieza, aceite, sopas, avenas, leche, queso, huevo, pan, verduras, pollo carne.

loans.name: Nidia Elena

texts.es: La señora  Nidia Elena es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es docente desde hace 20 años. Ella desempeña su labor en una escuela de la comunidad actividad que realiza con amor y esmero. El crédito lo invertirá en para seguir mejorando su vivienda con el anterior compuso su techo y con este comprara unos muebles.
texts.en: Nidia Elena is a hardworking and enterprising woman who has been a teacher for 20 years. She works in a public school and does it with love and care.  She will use the loan to continue improving her home by buying furniture.  She used her last loan to repair the roof.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Kawa

texts.en:
Kawa, age 45, is the owner of a typical Iraqi bakery, where he and his three staff members produce hundreds of pieces of flat bread per day. It is made by stretching the dough thin on a pillow which is then used for throwing the dough onto the side walls of the cave-like oven. He has been in this business for nine years.

Kawa has requested a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 3,000 USD to make essential repairs and renovations to his bakery, which has become dark from years of built-up smoke on the walls.

loans.use: to repair and renovate the walls of his bakery

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley, de 20 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ilusiones y ganas de progresar a base de su propio esfuerzo, siendo amable y cordial con las personas. Es conviviente con Luis quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de su única hija Sahomy de 3 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en la casa de su abuelo en compañía de su abuelo.
La actividad que realiza Shirley es la venta de frutas regionales por las mañanas, para lo cual instala una mesa en el frontis de su casa  donde atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial. También cuenta con un trabajo de corresponsal que lo realiza por las tardes ya que estudió periodismo generándole ingresos adicionales. Se inició en su negocio con un préstamo de MFP, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
 Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por ser la única en la zona con ese negocio siendo bastante solicitada. Antes de empezar con su negocio, tenía los deseos de ser un persona productiva y generar sus propios ingresos para no depender completamente de su pareja y apoyarlos con los gastos de su hogar. Por tanto, viendo los resultados de su negocio, desea continuar y con las ganancias más algún préstamo futuro abrir una pollería cerca a su casa pues lo ve como una oportunidad de negocio ya que no hay ninguno de ese rubro por la zona. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero necesario para concretar sus planes. Además está a gusto con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de sus productos para su negocio de frutas y arreglos de su casa, para acondicionar un espacio para un nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
20-year-old Shirley is a woman with a lot of hopes and a desire to make progress through her own efforts.  She is kind and friendly towards others.  Shirley lives with Luis who works in transportation and is the father of her only daughter, 3-year-old Sahomy, who she loves very much.  They live comfortably together in her grandfather's home together with her grandfather.

Shirley's business is selling regional fruits in the mornings.  She sets up a table in front of her home and serves her customers in a very kind and friendly manner.  She also works as a correspondent in the afternoons as she studied journalism.  This makes her additional income.  Shirley started her business through a loan from MFP and she works alone.

Shirley considers her business to be fairly profitable because of the money it makes her.  As she is the only person in her area who has this kind of business, her products are in demand.  She started her business because she wanted to become a productive person who made her own income.  She did not want to be completely dependent on her partner but instead wanted to help him cover their household expenses.  Given the results she has experienced in her business, she would like to continue working in it and use the profits she makes, together with a future loan, to open a poultry store near her home.  She sees this as a good business opportunity as there is no other business of this type in her area.

This will be Shirley's fourth loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support in achieving her goals.  She is happy with her community bank as it is a united and supportive group.  Shirley will invest the 1,500 soles she has requested in buying products for her fruit business and making some repairs to her home so that she can set up a space for her new business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Maliha

texts.en:
Maliha is 43 years old, a wife and a mother of three children. Her family lives in Iraq, and for the past 3 years she has been using her sewing skills to contribute to the family’s income. Working from home she is making dresses for her women customers.

Maliha took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD to buy a new sewing machine, fabric and raw materials.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lisbeth, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial con las personas. Está casada con Edver quien es independiente y padre de su hija Zunmy de 9 años de edad. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa en compañía de su sobrina a quien apoyan con su educación. La actividad que realza Lisbeth es el servicio de cuidado de los dientes, para eso a alquilado un local donde instaló su pequeña clínica dental, atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ofreciéndoles promociones por sus preferencias, de esa manera está haciendo crecer su cartera de clientes. 
Se inició hace más de 1 año con un capital propio y con el apoyo de su pareja que le ayuda en la atención   a sus clientes. Considera bastante rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancia que le deja ya que es muy concurrido su pequeña clínica.
Antes de comenzar con éste negocio no contaba con  ingresos propios y solo se dedicaba a estudiar, y con el apoyo de su pareja se decidió a empezar su negocio con los deseos de ser una prospera empresaria y apoyar con los gastos del hogar.
Espera de su negocio poder ampliarlo y comprar nuevos instrumentos para su clínica. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de  implementos y materiales para su clínica dental así como inmobiliarios para la recepción y la comodidad de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lisbeth, 34 years old, is hard-working and sincere, as well as being cheerful and friendly with people.  She is married to Edver, who is independent and the father of their nine-year-old daughter Zunmy.  Together they live comfortably in their own home along with a niece whose education they facilitate.  Lisbeth works in dental care.  She rents the small space where she set up her dental practice.  She attends her clients in a kind and friendly manner and offers customized promotions, thereby growing her customer base.

Lisbeth began her business more than a year ago with her own capital and with the suport of her partner, who helps with patient care.  The business is profitable due to the popularity of the small clinic.

Before starting this business, she was a full-time student and didn't have her own source of income.  With the help of her partner, she decided to start her own business with the hope of it thriving and allowing her to help with household expenses.

She hopes to expand her business and to buy new equipment for the clinic.  This will be her fourth loan through Kiva partner MFP.  She is happy and grateful to know that she can rely on financial help to realize her goals.  She is also comfortable with the community bank and familiar with its members, whom she considers to be friendly and supportive.

With the requested amont of $1,125, she will invest in instruments and supplies for her dental clinic as well as a reception area for her clients' comfort.

loans.use: to buy instruments and supplies for her dental clinic.

loans.name: Favio Javier

texts.es: El señor favio, es un humilde agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar la condicones de vida,  gracias al apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondo Kiva a logrado mejorar su cultivo de piña , la mayor afectacion que se le presenta en el cultivo es  que  por problemas de los desastres naturales la producción no salio en tiempo y forma esperada , quedando la piña de un tamaño muy pequeño y acida que en el mercado es mal pagada , el necesita el préstamo con mucha urgencia ya que se le esta pasando la hora de darle matenimiento para plicar fertilizantes e insumos encesarios para el cultivo .Para que esta cosecha sea de mejor calidad.
texts.en: Favio is a humble farmer in the Ticuantepe zone.  His plans for the future are to improve his quality of life.  Thanks to the support of Afodenic through Kiva, he has been able to improve his pineapple crop. The biggest challenge to his work has been natural disasters, which caused the production to not come out on time or in the desired shape.  The resulting pineapples were of a very small size and acidic, and earned very little in the market.  He needs the loan urgently since the time to maintain the crop and apply the necessary fertilizers is passing, and so that this harvest can be of better quality.

loans.use: buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im is a humble resident of the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He'd husband is a public school director earning a decent salary and they have two school-age kids. Im herself is involved in agribusiness to help her husband in generating income. She grows and harvests rice crops during two seasons of the year. 

It is now the season for Im to start growing during her dry-season as usual. However, Im is experiencing financial difficulties in paying for the farming process. She will use her loan funds to buy such items as rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. She will use part of her loan to pay for plowing. 

Im is very hopeful about her future and proud of her life as a rice cultivator. With the increased income, Im will increase her savings in order to expand her business as well as to enable her to provide her children with a full education.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en:
Ismail is a hard working 46 years old Iraqi man, he is married, and together with his wife they are raising five children.

Ismail started working at the young age of 13, earning much respect along with 33 years experience in the mechanics, machine and vehicle repair sector. A few years ago he injured his eye while fixing a generator.

Ismail took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD to improve his garage, and purchase some special, good quality tools to work with as well as equipment to move large and heavy machinery.

loans.use: to improve his garage, and purchase good quality tools and equipment to move large and heavy machinery.

loans.name: Kwimage Group

texts.en:
Godson, who is in his late 30s is married with with two children who go to school. He has been a DJ for 6 years.  He works from 9.00 pm to mid-night and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Godson's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more instruments like guitars and for  household expenses and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a new loan to buy better drums. His dream is to one day be able to improve on his instruments.

Godson will share this loan with his loan group "Kwimage" which has a total of 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans. (One lady's face could not be seen because it was hidden by the long hair of the lady wearing a white and blue sarong).

loans.use: to buy better drums.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 35 years old and married with three children. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for five years and has employed four people. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a mining machine.

loans.use: To buy a mining machine.

loans.name: Ngoné

texts.fr: Madame Ngoné  vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et  âgée de 69 ans. Depuis plus de 30 ans elle s’active dans la transformation de poissons séchés  ou salinés destinés a l’exportation.  C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi par passion mais aussi  dans le but de  contribuer  au développement économique de sa  localité.  La recherche de bénéfices l’intéresse  beaucoup. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour se procurer en    poissons salinés. Son intention est de renforcer son fond de roulement, accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie sociale de sa famille.
texts.en: Ngoné lives in Senegal. She is married and 69 years old. For more than 30 years she has been active preparing dried or salted fish for export. It is an activity she chose out of passion but also because she wanted to contribute to her town's economic development. The search for profit interests her significantly. She has been a member of one of the branches of U-IMCEC since August 2011. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy salted fish. Her intention is to strengthen her working capital, increase her profits and improve her family's social conditions.

loans.use: to procure salted fish for resale

loans.name: Makimbilio Group

texts.fr: La cliente Katempa, leader du groupe d’affaire «Makimbilio », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 44  ans, mariée, mère de 8 jeunes enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est  vendeuse de boissons (Primus, Fanta, etc. Il y a  12 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  7eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  20 casiers de Primus, Fanta, etc.).  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement, accroitre son entreprise et acheter une seconde maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The customer Katempa, who is the leader of the Makimbilio business group, is a businesswoman who is 44 years old, married and mother to eight young children, who are all studying. Her husband is unemployed. She sells drinks (Primus, Fanta, etc.). She has been carrying out these kinds of small income-generating business for the past twelve years. Meanwhile, she has just been granted her seventh loan from Hékima. This new loan will enable her to get fresh supplies of 20 crates of Primus, Fanta, etc. In the future she would like to see her children grow up comfortably, expand her business and buy a second house. The customer thanks Hékima for its actions in favor of poor women who have no access to classic banks.

loans.use: to pay for 20 crates of Primus, Fanta, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty years old, married, with four children. She does tailoring to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and describes her business environment as good because she is visited regularly by her customers. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya,she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a tailoring machine.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida will use the Kiva loan amount in her clothes-selling business to purchase bulk quantity and different varieties of clothes. This will help her to target more clients and increase her sales and profits. Her husband works in a government organization for a low income.

Khalida has given birth to two sons and two daughters. None of her children could complete their education due to financial constraints. Her elder son is a rickshaw driver while her remaining children stay at home. Khalida is also a very good housewife and performs her household duties very well.

She is very supportive and started her business few years ago to financially help her husband. She hopes that the loan investment will help her to make her business more profitable.

Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Khalida."

loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Au

texts.en:
Au is 41 years old, living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province, which is her hometown. She has a life partner and has been blessed with two children. Her oldest child is already married and lives separately, but the other one is single and works as sewing staff for a garment factory. Au is a good mother who always thinks of and cares for her children’s future because she wants to see them make a better living and obtain a comfortable life. 

Au tries to work hard in her rice field. She doesn’t want her second child to work in the position any longer and she wishes to support her child to attend a class for a specific skill, for example, to be a seamstress. So Au now is looking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to pay for a specific course of study for her child. Au said that she has nothing to provide to her child beside education and skills.

loans.use: to pay for a course study for her child.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon, age 65, lives in the Pouk district of Kompong Tom province. She earns an income by making and selling bamboo baskets. She and her husband have eight children, four of whom are grown and have their own families. The younger four live at home and usually assist Phon in making the baskets, a skill taught to them by Phon. Typically, Phon is able to generate approximately 8.00 USD per day through this business.

Phon has decided to borrow funds from HKL, a partner of Kiva since 2008, in order to start up and operate a small pig-fattening business behind her house. She will build a wooden pigpen and buy five pigs to keep in it. This will increase the family income and provide a more stable life. She will use it to build a wooden pigpen and buy five pigs to keep in it. Phon’s dream is to provide a quality of life to her children.

loans.use: to build a wooden pigpen and buy five pigs to keep in it

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
From Kompong Cham province, Horn, age 32, together with her spouse, is in the business of constructing and painting houses. Horn usually follows her husband everywhere around the province for jobs and money. Together, they are able to earn in the neighborhood of $10 USD per day and try hard to raise their two dependent school-age children.

With the amount of $600 USD she requested from HKL, Horn will buy construction supplies such as a ladder for painting, painting brushes and other tools to sustain and improve her present business.

For her future goal, Horn anticipates owning a shop for selling construction supplies, including paint.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies.

loans.name: Soung

texts.en:
Soung is 38 years old and a mother of five single children. She helps her husband, a motor-taxi driver, to earn income by collecting and purchasing recycled materials through the whole commune of Reussey Keo, Phnom Penh city. 

Presently, her family owns a long-used motorcycle, which always has some mechanical problems while her husband is providing his service. To solve this problem, Soung is coming to HKL again to borrow her ninth loan to purchase a motorcycle for both household use and business use. She hopes that her living status will become better through using the loan from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for both household use and business use.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 44 years old. He lives in Kechut village with his wife, mother and three children. Artur works at the fire brigade as a fireman, but his salary is not enough to cover the family's costs. So to sustain the family, Artur also keeps livestock. The number of livestock on his farm is 20. Artur has a big barn and all the necessary conditions to keep the livestock, so he would like to increase its number to 23. This loan will help Artur to purchase livestock and expand his farm, which means increased income for him.

Artur wants to see his children well-educated in the future, and additional income will give him opportunity to make savings for this purpose and insure a prosperous future for them.

loans.use: to pay for livestock.

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban is a 26-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She now has a lovely young kid who completely depends on her care. Ban is involved in making bamboo baskets and rice husbandry. Thus, she spends her time dedicated to the two businesses from day to day, whereas her husband works to provide construction services to local people around the province. 

In order to continually develop her businesses, Ban has applied for a loan of $300 USD from HKL to supplement her existing capital to purchase a rice-husking machine, which she will use to peel off the outer covering of rice. Furthermore, she also can use it to provide rice-husking services to people in her neighborhood for money and in exchange for rice. With the remaining funds, she will buy raw materials for making her bamboo baskets. Ban surely will be able to improve her standard of living through using this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a rice-husking machine and buy raw materials for making her bamboo baskets.

loans.name: Drastamat

texts.en:
Drastamat, age 25, is a cattle breeder. He earns additional income by working at the local court and is also engaged in agriculture. He lives with his parents. The family has been involved in cattle breeding for many years and Drastamat always helped his parents with the farm. Now he has enough experience and does the larger part of the work himself. 

The farm includes two cows at present, and Drastamat would like to purchase one more cow to earn more income. Drastamat also plans to purchase forage to feed the cattle. 

Drastamat dreams of starting his own family. The development of the farm will allow him to ensure a better quality of life for his parents and to save for his own eventual family.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and for cattle forage

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Karanja is twenty-six years old, married, with one child. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya,he has been able to save his income and hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a thirty-three-year-old entrepreneur from Yerevan. He trades men and women's clothing from a rented booth in the city market. Karen's wife helps him with business and commutes with him when he goes abroad to purchase inventory. Karen has applied for this loan to increase the variety of clothing he has. In particular he wants to purchase clothing for the coming spring season and to meet the client demand. 

This loan will help Karen to increase his sales and earn more income, which is absolutely vital for him to ensure better living conditions for his wife and two children. Karen dreams of opening his own shop, and developing his current business will give him an opportunity to make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 48-year-old married man. 

Last year he opened a small food market/grocery store in the neighborhood for selling snacks, cans of vegetables, macaroni, etc. Now he has applied for this loan to add more variety in the products he is selling in the store.

loans.use: to add more variety to his grocery store inventory

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada, a 60-year-old married woman, has three sons and a daughter. 

Saada owns a home products shop in an active area in the market. She uses the income she gets from the store either to help in supporting the family or to buy new products. 

Now Saada has applied for a loan to buy new home products so she can have a variety of them in the store and expand the internal store space.

loans.use: to buy new home products

loans.name: Eyad

texts.en:
Eyad prefers not to have his photo published online, so his brother Emad appears in his Kiva profile photo in the place where he raises his ornamental birds.

Eyad is a forty-one-year-old man and a father with four sons and two daughters. He is an employee of the Palestinian National Authority and gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs. 

For the past three years, Eyad has also been raising and selling ornamental birds, which has been a profitable project.

Eyad is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing more ornamental birds and improving the condition of the place where he raises them. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a bulk stock of ornamental birds to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther, age 50, is a tailor. She is the mother of two children. She has been in the tailoring business for 10 years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Esther has been able to pay for the education of her children. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kenya Shillings in order to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material for making clothes.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine and cloth material for making clothes

loans.name: Salwa

texts.en:
Salwa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her son Alaa appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Salwa is a fifty-year-old woman, a mother with two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets low salary.

Salwa is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of installing new tiles in the kitchen and improving its condition. This will improve the family's home living conditions.

loans.use: To pay to install new tiles for the kitchen.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en: Syombua is thirty-four years old, married, with two children. She runs a cafeteria to earn a living. She has been in the business for five years and employs three people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy utensils, sugar and rice.

loans.use: To buy utensils, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson, age 34, earns a living as a photographer. He has been in the business for 10 years and describes his business environment as thriving because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to build savings and hopes to expand his business in the future. He is married and has two children.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 Kenya Shillings in order to buy two digital cameras.

loans.use: to buy two digital cameras for his photography business

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Griselda, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Elvis quien es obrero y padre de sus 3 hijos que son Liza de 18, Elvis de 14 y Brenda de 5 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa  que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Griselda es la venta de productos de belleza como esmaltes, labiales, lociones y otros. También vende ropas variadas para damas, caballeros y niños de diversos modelos y que están a la moda. Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogos y los vende desde su casa entre  sus amistades, familiares y vecinos a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial logrando ganarse su preferencia, así ellos la recomiendan con otras personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales.
Se inicio hace más de 4 años contando con un capital propio y hasta el momento le ayuda su hermana e hija en conseguir nuevos clientes.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la oportunidad de ser una prospera empresaria.
Antes de empezar con su actividad tuvo problemas económicos ya que no ejercía su profesión de docente y necesitaba de un ingreso económico para seguir solventando la educación de sus hijos ya que con los ingresos de su pareja solo les alcanzaba para la alimentación. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados tiene planes de continuar y con las ganancias invertir en arreglos de su casa para acondicionar cuartos para alquiler, buscando generase más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Está contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso asegura será puntal con el pago de sus cuotas para tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a mas prestamos en el futuro. Por otro lado comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus integrantes ser personas buenas y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como ropas de variadas modelos para todos los géneros ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar. También comprará más mercaderías de productos de belleza para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando en ambos casos precios más bajos por sus compras al contado y en volumen.
texts.en:
Griselda, who is 40 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman, in addition to being cordial and happy. She has a great will to advance. She lives with her partner, Elvis, who is a laborer and the father of their three children, Liza, who is 18, Elvis, who is 14, and Brenda, who is 5. Together they live comfortably in their own house, which they bought with great effort.

Griselda's business is selling beauty products such as nail polish, lipstick, lotions, and other items. She also sells a variety of clothing for women, men, and children, items in different styles and that are in fashion. She acquires all these products through catalogs and she sells them from her house to her friends, relatives, and neighbors, whom she serves in a kind and cordial manner, winning their business. Thus they recommend her to other people, who in time become regular customers.

She began this business more than four years ago, with a little capital of her own, and so far her sister and her daughter have helped her obtain new customers. She considers her business fairly profitable because of the earnings it provides her, along with the opportunity to be a prosperous businesswoman.

Before beginning her business, she had financial problems, since she was not practicing her profession of teaching, and she needed an income to continue paying for the education of their children, since her partner's income was only sufficient for food. Now, seeing her good results, she has plans to continue and with her earnings invest in arranging their house to refurbish rooms to rent, looking to generate more income.

This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support to advance with her business. For this, she assures that she will be punctual in making her payments to have a good credit record and have access to more loans in the future. In addition, she comments that she feels comfortable in her communal bank because she considers all the members to be good and united people. With the 2000 PEN that she has applied for, she will invest in the purchase of merchandise such as clothing of various styles for all genders, since she has orders to fill. She will also buy more beauty products to have a stock on hand for sale, in both cases seeking lower prices by making her purchases for cash and in volume.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and clothing to sell

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah, age 56, owns and operates a grocery store to earn a living. She has been in the business for 24 years and has employed one person. She earns extra income from her rental houses. She and her husband have four children.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 100,000 Kenya Shillings to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to offer for sale and to buy colored paint to use to upgrade her rental houses.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and onions to offer for sale and to buy colored paint to use to upgrade her rental houses

loans.name: Sén

texts.en: Sén is 20 years old. She generates her monthly income working for a garment factory as a member of the sewing staff.  Her husband, who is 3 years older than Sén, works to provide construction service around the city. This young couple has been blessed with a lovely child. Sén tells us that she would like to use this loan to purchase a used motorcycle to better her living; they usually takes motor-service to reach their workplaces. This loan will reduce some expenses during the month. She is very thankful to our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Marja

texts.es:
Marja, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Daniel quien es independiente y padre de sus 4 hijos, pero 2 ya son independientes. Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de 2 de sus hijos de 19 y 17 años de edad a quienes quieren mucho. La actividad que realiza Marja es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas para eso tiene en su casa una refrigeradora donde guarda sus productos  a temperatura helada al gusto de sus clientes por lo caluroso de la zona, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes.
También tiene un mototaxi el cual lo alquilan generándoles ingresos adicionales.
Se inició hace más de 7 años con ambos negocios, luego con las ganancias fue haciendo arreglos en su casa para la venta de bebidas, poniendo mesas y sillas para la comodidad de sus clientes y hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene sus productos.
Se decido empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con sus propios ingresos y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, considerando que así lograrán progresar más rápidamente.
Por tanto, viendo los resultados de sus negocios, tiene deseos de continuar y aumentar el stock de sus productos para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 8 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida y contenta al saber que seguirá contando con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías en mayor volumen, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, así obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Marja is a hardworking and dedicated woman who really wants to get ahead.  She lives with her partner, Daniel, who is independent and the father of her four children, two of whom are on their own.  They live together in their own home with their two children who are 19 and 17 and whom they love very much.  Marja sells different brands and flavors of carbonated drinks for a living.  For this business, she has a refrigerator in her house where she keeps her products ice cold like her customers like them because it is so hot where she lives.  She serves her customers from there very courteously.

She also has a mototaxi that she rents out to earn extra income.

She started both businesses over seven years ago, then used her earnings to set up her house to sell drinks by putting in tables and chairs for her customers' comfort.  So far she has done all of this on her own.

She thinks her business is pretty profitable because of the earnings she has made and because of the demand for her products.

She decided to start her business because she wanted to be able to have her own income to count on to help her partner with the household expenses.  She thought that it would allow them to make progress more quickly.

As such, seeing the results of her businesses, she wants to continue and increase her stock in her products in order to see her business grow.  This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She is thankful and happy to know that she can continue to count on their financial support to move ahead with her business.  She is also happy with her communal bank because she knows the other members and she considers them to be responsible people.  With the requested sum of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy merchandise in greater volume and look for better prices for her purchases, which will allow her to earn more.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of soft drinks

loans.name: Mhabat

texts.en:
Mhabat is a 52 year woman from Iraq. She is married and has four children. 

For the past 12 years Mhabat has been using her sewing skills to help with the family's income. Working from home she has been able to set a good example for her children about the meaning of precise work by always meeting her clients' needs.

Mhabat took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2400 USD to buy an overlock sewing machine and to improve her work area.

loans.use: to buy a new overlock sewing machine and to improve her work area

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
