Peng is a good mother who is aged thirty-nine, living in Dongkor commune, Phnom Penh city. She has been operating a business as a recycled materials collector. She is very diligent in her career to generate income because she wants to provide her children a comfortable living and basic necessities. However, she realizes that only education can alleviate the poverty of this family. Therefore, she will strive to work harder and continually support her two school-age kids with a further education.

She would like to take out her first loan from Kiva, through HKL to purchase a used motorcycle for her daily needs. She will keep any left-over funds to use as capital for purchasing recycled materials from the local people living in her neighborhood. Peng hopes to improve her business gradually, and wants to be the owner of a medium-sized recycling business someday.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her daily needs.

loans.name: Yov

texts.en:
Yov, age thirty-eight, is married woman who has been residing in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common law relationship with her husband and has two school-age children. Yov has spent most of her life cultivating rice alongside her husband within the two seasons of the year. 

She requested a loan of 300 USD to pay for the funeral ceremony of her mother who passed away a few weeks ago. She hopes our lenders will help her family in their time of need. She tells us that she will pay back her loan regularly as scheduled.

loans.use: to pay for her mother's funeral expenses.

loans.name: Piedad

texts.es:
Piedad de 35 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, emprendedora con ganas de superación, además de ser muy amable y social. Es separada, ella se dedica a la actividad de costura.es madre de 3 hijos, de 18,15 y 10 años de edad .vive en su casa propia lo cual logro construir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Piedad es la costura, cose ropas para damas caballeros y niños para toda ocasión, promociones, quince años, escolares y otros, lo cual lo realiza en su casa propia en un ambiente bien equipado con máquinas de coser y muebles, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Trabaja en una empresa privada medio tiempo y por las tardes realiza la actividad de costura. Se inició con esta actividad ya que aprendió al ver como cosía su madre y notando que es rentable. Cuando empezó, solo tenía una máquina que compró con un préstamo de MFP, ahora está bien implementada. Esta actividad lo realiza con una amiga.
Nos comenta que esta actividad  lo considera rentable porque le da un buen ingreso económico y así ella puede brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos, y una buena comodidad. Y puede pagar los gastos de su casa ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos. Antes de empezar con este negocio su sueldo no le alcanzaba. Espera seguir creciendo y comprar nuevas máquinas y ampliar su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la MFP, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Por otro lado nos comenta que está muy contenta por ser parte de un grupo responsable. Con el préstamo solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles comprará materiales de costura como telas, elásticos entre otros  para implementar su negocio y atender los pedidos que tiene por entregar, todos estos materiales los traerá desde la capital buscando conseguir precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Piedad is a charismatic, enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and who is also very kind and social.  She is separated and she sews for a living.  She is the mother of three children who are 18, 15, and 10 years old.  She lives in her own home, which she was able to build through a lot of hard work.  Piedad sews, making clothing for men, women, and children for all occasions: graduations, fifteenth birthday parties, school clothes, and more.  She makes everything in her own home in an area well equipped with sewing machines and furniture where she attends her customers very courteously.  She works for a private company half-time and in the afternoons she sews.  She started in this business because she learned sewing from watching her mother and realized that it is profitable.  When she started, she only had one machine that she bought with and MFP loan, but now she's well set up.  She does this business with a friend.

She tells us that she considers her business to be profitable because she makes a good income that allows her to offer her children a better education and a good level of comfort.  It also allows her to cover her household expenses as she is both mother and father to her children.  Before starting this business her income didn't cover everything.  She hopes to keep growing, to buy new machines, and to expand her business.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to be able to count on the financial support she has received.  Because of it, she will make progress with her business and she will become a great businesswoman.  She also tells us that she is very happy to be part of a responsible group.  With the requested loan for 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and elastic, among other things, to use in her business and to complete the orders she has pending.  She will get all of these materials in the capital in order to look for better prices for her bulk purchases.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, zippers, and other sewing materials

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a conservative woman who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.
Huda is a 35 year old woman who is a mother with five sons and one daughter. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee who gets a low salary which is not enough to cover the family's needs and to pay for making some repairs in the house.
Huda is requesting a 2,000 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of changing tiles and doors and installing new tiles and new doors instead. This will improve the family's home living conditions and enable them to live in better conditions.

loans.use: To change her old house's tiles and doors.

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Nop is 49 years old and lives with his family in the  Pouk district, Siem Reap province. He is married with 3 children attending school. To generate income, Nop is involved in pig husbandry. As shown in the photo, Nop built a wooden piggery in his yard and placed about ten piglets to raise there. From this business, he is able to earn about  5 USD per day to cover his daily expenses.

Nop would like to request a loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase feed and vitamins to keep fattening his pigs. He hopes that his business will improve by using a generous loan from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins to keep fattening his pigs.

loans.name: Nep

texts.en:
Nep, age 34, a good mother of 3 school-age children who are under her care, has been operating a micro pig-raising business to generate income in addition to growing rice . She has been in this business for over 3 years and she typically earns approximately 5 USD per day. 

With the amount she requested from HKL, she’ll use it to buy a plot of farmland to expand her farming business. Nep hopes that she’ll be able to make a good harvest in the coming season. For her future goal, she’ll save money to attain her dream of having a big farm for a pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But, age 31, lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She is the mother of four children, all of whom are students. Mrs. But is a rice farmer as well as a pig-raiser. Normally, she is able to generate income of 2.50 USD per day. Her husband shares his responsibility for the family by providing a threshing service to the local people in exchange for money and rice. 

In order to better her family's living conditions, Mrs. But has decided to ask for a loan from HKL to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the family’s use and also to buy a breeding pig to raise for its offspring. In the future, Mrs. But wants to expand her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for the family’s use and also to buy a breeding pig to raise for its offspring

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum, age 50, is the responsible mother of eight children, living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has spent most of her lifetime dedicated to crop husbandry, growing such crops as rice and vegetables on her own farmland, and she typically earns an average of 3.00 USD per day. Her husband helps in managing this process in each season.

Chum is now asking for a loan of 1,000.00 USD in order to purchase farming materials such as vegetable seed, fertilizers, and pesticides. Moreover, she will use a part of the fund to purchase some piglets for raising. Chum hopes to develop her business and better her family's living conditions in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as vegetable seed, fertilizers, and pesticides

loans.name: Peanh

texts.en:
Peanh is 57 years old. He lives together with his family in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. The main business of the family is agriculture, including growing crop and animal husbandry. Peanh now has eight children: six are married and two are single. Some of them are employed at the moment.

Peanh is applying for a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a used motorcycle for his employed children to commute to their workplaces. With the remaining loan funds, he’ll buy fertilizers for his corn crop. Peanh is very grateful for the support in his family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for his employed children to commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Hazron

texts.en:
Hazron, age 28, sells sweaters, blouses, and skirts to earn a living. He has been in the business for nine years and has employed one person. He sells fruits and vegetables to earn extra income. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Hazron has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He and his wife have one child.

He has applied for a loan in the amount of 60,000 Kenya Shillings to buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to offer for sale.

loans.use: To buy sweaters, blouses, and skirts to offer for sale

loans.name: Mwale Group

texts.en:
Asma, who is in her late thirties, is married with two children who are still going to school.  She has been selling air time and new clothes door to door since 1990.  She works from 10.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling children and ladies clothes which she sells door to door, to buy more air time, a TV set, TV stand, kitchen cupboard and to pay school fees and has paid back all her loans successfully.  Now she would like a loan to start selling food.  Her dream is to one day own a hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mwale" which has a total of sixteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to start selling food door to door.

loans.name: Hiari Ya Moyo Group

texts.en:
Podensiana, who is in her early fifties, is married with one child who is in college.  She has been a food vendor since 1980.  She works from 6.00 am to 2.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in her food store and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to still restock the missing items in her food business. Her dream is to one day have a big hotel.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Hiari ya moyo" which has a total of ninteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her food store.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine, age 37, lives in Malishka village with her husband and two sons. The family is involved in two kinds of agricultural business: cattle breeding and land cultivation. Narine's farm now includes two cows, two calves, and hens. She also keeps a greenhouse. 

She has applied for this loan in order to invest in the farm and greenhouse development. With the loan's help, she plans to purchase two cows and seedS to cultivate the land in the greenhouse. Expansion of the farm will allow Narine to earn more income.

Narine wants her children to have access to higher education, and an increased development of agriculture will allow her to build savings toward this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase two cows as well as seeds to cultivate the land in her greenhouse

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs Ream is a married mother with seven children, located in one province, which consists mostly of businesses such as rice, living stock, fishing and other crops. She is a cultivator with her humble husband who is very experienced in this field.  When not working, this lovely couple always takes time to go fishing around the pond, lake and also river.  

Through this second loan, both of them can earn approximately $2 per day to cover their family expenses.  This family wants to change their life in happiness, prosperity and condition like many others so they want to apply for a small loan through HKL, a partner with Kiva.  The purpose of this loan is to purchase fertilizer to make their crops grow well.  They hope that all kind donors will pity and offer their help.  They commit that they will pay back the funders punctually.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Ukonga Group

texts.en:
Frolenca, who is in his late thirties is married with three children, two of whom go to school.  He has been a butcher for nineteen years now.  He works from 8.00 pm to morning (overnight) daily and can make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy more meat, started building his own house and pay his home expenses and has paid back his loans successfully.  His dream is to one day be able to own an international butcher business.  

He will share loan with his loan group "Tujikwamue Ukonga" which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eudocia

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene 54 años, es casada hace 35 años, tiene 6 hijos con edades entre 34 y 12 años, algunos de ellos ya son independientes, vive con su familia en una aldea de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Su negocio es una pulpería de productos alimenticios como (arroz, manteca, harina, frijoles, pan, etc.), abarrotes y algunos productos enlatados. Este negocio lo estableció hace 8 años con sus propios medios. Es una señora muy trabajadora y con el fin de generar otro ingreso extra que le ayudaría ha contribuir con los gastos del hogar fue que logro establecerlo. Ella le dedica 8 horas al negocio.
Doña Maria ha obtenido varios financiamientos con ODEF que la han ayudado a mejorar su negocio, en la actualidad solicita otro préstamo de 10,000 lempiras para abastecerse de productos de la canasta básica. (arroz, manteca, Frijoles,harina, azúcar, huevos y churros).Con lo que va a invertir piensa mejorar su economía.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para que sus ingresos puedan ser mejores cada día.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 54 years old.  She has been married for 35 years, and has six children aged between 12 and 34 years old, some of whom are already financially independent.  She lives with her family in a village in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Her business is a convenience store selling food items such as rice, butter, flour, bread, etc, groceries, and some canned goods.  She established this business eight years ago through her own means.  She is a very hard-working woman, who established this business with the goal of earning extra income which would help her contribute to the household expenses.  She works in the business for eight hours a day

Doña Maria has obtained various loans through ODEF which have helped her to improve her business.  She is currently requesting a new loan of 10,000 lempiras to stock up on basic grocery products (rice, butter, beans, flour, sugar, eggs and churros (similar to doughnuts).  She hopes to improve her financial situation with this investment.

Her goal is to continue working, so that her income can improve on a daily basis.

loans.use: to purchase basic groceries (rice, butter, beans, flour, sugar, eggs and churros (a type of doughnut).

loans.name: Cruz Absalon

texts.es: Cruz, un sencillo, humilde pero muy trabajador campesino originario de La Concordia, municipio de Jinotega al norte de Estelí. Nos cuenta que sus experiencias con los créditos Kiva han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio y ha mejorado los ingresos para su familia. El anterior préstamo lo utilizo para sembrar tomates y repollo en poca cantidad, su producción fue muy buena aunque noto que le hizo falta sembrar un área mas de repollo que ha sido muy solicitado por sus clientes. Es por tal motivo que esta solicitando este crédito para comprar insumos,fertilizantes,abono, pago de mano de obra, gasolina para bomba de riego de siembra para cultivar 2 manzanas de repollo. Entre uno de sus proyectos esta comprar una área mas de terreno para sembrar hortalizas y seguir trabajando para brindarle  un mejor futuro    a su familia
texts.en: Cruz is a hard-working "campesino" from La Concordia in Nicaragua.  He tells us that Kiva loans have helped him grow his farming business and, in turn, better support his family.  He used his last loan to plant tomatoes and cabbage.  He was pleased with his yields, he says, and wants to plant more cabbage to meet the demand from his customers.  He is applying for a loan to buy supplies--fertilizers, manure, gasoline to run his pumps--and pay for day laborers.  He will plant 2 "manzanas" (not sure, but city-block-size plots, presumably) of cabbage.  For the future, he wants to buy more land so that he can plant other vegetables.  The investment will help him to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Bernard, age 30, is a resident of Kitale town in Western Kenya. He has been engaged in active farming for five years, and his farm produces milk, eggs, and maize. He sells these at the local market. For additional income, Bernard runs a video show business in the town, where people also gather to watch football.

Bernard has requested 82,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo. 62,400 KES will help him buy and insure a dairy cow. He will also boost his poultry business by buying more poultry birds for 20,000 KES. The additional cow will allow the farm to produce enough milk to be available for the family's own consumption, and Bernard will be able to meet other family needs with the additional income. 

He aspires toward eventually owning a "posho-meal" for processing cereals in the market.

He laments the high costs of feed for dairy cows, especially during dry seasons, but he is confident that this expansion will enable him to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and poultry birds

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong is a 29-year-old married mother with two children. She is located in the Baray District of Kampong Thom Provice, Cambodia. She has been married to Mr. Sok, who has a career as a farmer. Beside this industry, her humble husband also is a fisherman around pounds, lakes and rivers. Through this second type of industry, he can earn about $3 per day for covering his family's daily expenses. 

All the income that the husband has is still not enough for supporting his family's needs yet, so Kong would like to request some funds from all the kind lenders who always care about the lives of the poor. The purpose of this loan is to purchase seed and also fertilizer. She hopes that these funds will make the family meet happiness and prosperity. Her dreams in the future are to see the children get a good education and good jobs, and she would like to see their house be larger than it is at present.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is a 37-year-old farmer from Agarak village. He has been engaged in the agricultural business for more than 10 years, and through this period has sustained his family, which includes his wife and daughter. 

In order to cover the family's rising costs, Nver wants to develop his farm and earn more income. Nver plans to purchase more cattle and forage to feed the cattle. This loan will help Nver to earn additional income, which is important for him to insure a higher quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and forage.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya and lives with her family of four children aged between thirteen and five years old. Their source of livelihood is her farming. She currently produces maize, beans and vegetables which she sells to the local market.

Jane has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the acquisition of a dairy cow will provide milk for family consumption as well as additional income to meet other needs. She is confident she will manage to repay the loan and acquire a bigger amount in future.

She notes however that food and water shortage during dry seasons remains a major challenge to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mikocheni Group

texts.en:
Damasi, who is in his early thirty's, is married with two children who go to school.  He has been a food vendor since 2002. He works from 6.00 am to 12.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy the missing items in his food store, took care of his family and has paid back his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy the still-missing items. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mikocheni" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his food store.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a mother of  six children; all are above 18 years old and are attending post-secondary education. She is aged 43 and has practiced mixed farming actively for the past 10 years. Her farm produces and sells milk and maize to the local market. Her farm currently runs with the help of one farmhand.

Christine has requested a loan of 62,400 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will boost her farming income and enable her to improve her farming business to make it a more reliable business. She hopes to acquire more assets for the family and ensure financial security.

Christine laments the high costs of animal management, with treatment being the major challenge, sometimes causing fatality for the animals.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cheyech

texts.en:
Cheyech is aged thirty-five and has been in farming for five years. She is married with two children aged seven and eight. Her farm produces milk, vegetables, eggs and maize. She also runs a money transfer business popularly known as “M-PESA” in addition to farming. She currently employs one farmhand.

Cheyech has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a “posho mill”. This is a cereals processing machine which will allow her to boost her income by processing and selling her maize produce as a finished product of maize flour. She says with the high production of maize in the entire Kitale area she expects to make more income and educate her children and improve their living standards.

Cheyech says the dairy business has become difficult with rampant diseases leading to loss in dairy animals and subsequently to income. She remains focused on timely repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill.

loans.name: Jacinter

texts.en:
Jacinter is a farmer in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya. She is aged thirty-six and married with three children aged between ten and four, all of whom are already schooling. Her farm produces maize and eggs for the local market.

Jacinter has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy more birds and make full utilization of the housing unit she constructed on her poultry farming venture. She believes more poultry birds will improve her income and provide a better diet for her family.

She too laments of high costs associated with animal farming, which is recurrent.

loans.use: To buy poutry birds.

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en:
Ashot is a thirty-four-year-old entrepreneur from Yereavan. He owns a shop, where he makes doors, awnings and other wooden things. Ashot started his business in 2009, and due to the quality of his work has a large number of clients. 

Now Ashot has many orders to complete, for which he needs to purchase necessary equipment and wood. This will help Ashot to finish the orders with quality and on time. Ashot will increase his working capital, which is vital for him to have sufficient means and invest in further expansion of the business.

loans.use: to pay for wood and equipment.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is twenty-three years old. He lives in with his parents and grandparents. Agriculture has been the main source of income for the family for many years. Arsen has always helped his family with cattle breeding and land cultivating and now he has enough experience to develop the farm. 

Arsen plans to purchase calves, which will allow him to generate more income for his family. Arsen dreams of starting his own family with children, so developing the farm will allow him to be sure of being able to give his family a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Sin Limites (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Sin Limites esta formado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que en Diciembre de 1999 fue nombrada como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, es la tercera ciudad más importante del país, la belleza de sus paisajes, la variedad en su gastronomía la hacen una ciudad encantadora para visitar. Su gente es amable, gentil, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos como nuestras socias quienes luchan día a día en sus diferentes actividades para mejorar la  económica de sus hogares y sacar  adelante a sus familias. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Angélica, tiene 30 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 9, 4 y 1 año de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Angélica es comerciante ambulantemente, vende cobijas, cobertores, sabanas etc. labora en esta actividad hace 7 años y trabaja de miércoles a sábados sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cobijas y cobertores para aumentar su mercadería.

Su meta es que sus hijos se superen y lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The 8 members of the Sin Limites community bank, 7 women and 1 man, live in different parts of Cuenca.  Cuenca is a World Heritage site and the third most important city in Ecuador.  Visitors also come here to enjoy the surrounding countryside and the area's famous cuisine.  The people here are friendly and supportive of one another.  They work hard to maintain local culture.  They, like our members, also work hard to support their families and get ahead in the world.

Sra. Angelica, 30, is one of our members.  She and her husband have 3 children: 9, 4, and 1, respectively.  Their oldest child is a student at a local primary school.  Doña Angélica's husband works for a private employer and the couple own the house where they live.  
 
Doña Angélica works as a street vendor.  She sells bedding: sheets, blankets, etc.  She has operated her business for 7 years, working from Wednesdays to Saturdays, with no fixed hours. 

A friend invited Doña Angélica to join the community bank.  This is her first loan and she will use it to stock her business with merchandise--blankets, for example--that she will resell.

She wants to help her children study for paid careers.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mr. So is a married man who has 10 children. He is located in the Prey Chor District of Kampong Charm province, Cambodia. Three of the children are living with him, and the other seven are married and live in separate houses from each other. 

To establish a comfortable living for the big family, Mr. So is working hard from day to day to support his family's everyday needs. He plants and harvests rice and corn for sale. He has been engaged in his business for many years with his lovely wife and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.  

Currently, he is an entrepreneur who generates his business from land perhaps 2 hectares in size. Now, he would like to rent the farm from his neighbor for more output than last year, but he does not have enough capital for renting yet, so he wants to apply for a small loan from HKL micro-finance, a partner with Kiva. He is expecting that, through these funds, his business will grow and earn more profit.

loans.use: To rent farmland.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and children. Armen has been engaged in farming for 10 years already. Through this period, he has successfully run a greenhouse and the farm, and earned enough income to sustain the family. 

Armen has applied for this loan to complete the land cultivation. He plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer. Armen hopes to gather a rich harvest, which he plans to sell to local retailers. This will allow him to generate income for his family and insure improved living conditions for them.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is forty-one years old. He lives in Shinuhayr village with his wife and three children. Stepan got involved in cattle breeding five years ago in order to have stable source of income for his family. Stepan would like to sell more meat and milk, for which he needs to purchase more cattle. Stepan also wants to renovate his tractor by purchasing some necessary equipment for it. This will make the process of land cultivation faster and more effective. 

Stepan dreams of a future, where his children will be well-educated and live in stable economical conditions. Development of cattle breeding gives him confidence that he can make this dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for cattle and agricultural equipment.

loans.name: Actable The Best Group

texts.en:
Christian, who is in his early sixties, is married with five children, one of whom is still at university.  He has been selling fried fish for five years now. He works from 7.00 am to 2.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more buckets of fish, took care of his family (food and hospital) and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy still more buckets of fish to sell. His dream is to one day become an international business man.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Actable The Best" which has a total of twenty-one members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is twenty-seven years old. He lives in Goris with his big family: his parents, grandmother, brother and sisters. Aram started his agricultural business with only three beehives, but due to his hard work and patience has increased the number of beehives to forty. Aram's farm also includes fifteen pigs.  

Now Aram would like to earn more income by developing his pig-breeding. For this reason he has applied for this loan to purchase pigs and forage to feed them. Aram is very excited about expanding his farm and plans to increase the number of beehives, too. He also dreams of starting his family, and additional income is vital for him to create higher quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Bethania Group

texts.en:
Jackson, who is in his early fifties is married with seven children who are still going to school.  He has been running a butchers shop, selling meat, for fifteen years now.  He works from 5.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy more meat, took care of his family and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more meat for his butcher shop. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "BETHANIA" which has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Sopey Nabi Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé actuellement de 5 membres qui habitent le même village et partageant des valeurs sociales communes.

Madame Sokhna est une femme mariée âgée de 60 ans et mère de 9 enfants et 1 neuve à sa charge.

Elle appartient au groupe de solidarité Sopey nabi qui a été crée depuis le premier cycle du BV .

Sokhna fait du commerce de détail dans la vente de lampes torches une activité qu'elle maitrise bien pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis longtemps.

Avec son nouveau crédit de 20000 francs CFA  elle va acheter 35 lampes torches qu'elle va revendre au niveau de sa localité et environs.

Ses bénéfices lui permettront de payer les fournitures scolaires de deux de ses enfants  mais également du riz et de l'huile pour toute la famille.
texts.en:
This group is currently made up of five members who live in the same village and who share the same social values.

Sokhna is 60 years old, married, and mother of nine children and one newborn who is in her care.

She belongs to the Sopey nabi solidarity group, which was founded at the time of their first loan cycle with the banc villageois.

Sokhna retails flashlights, an activity that she has gotten good at after having done it for a long time.

With her new 20,000 FCFA loan, she will buy 35 flashlights, which she will then resell in her town and in the surrounding areas.

The profits will allow her to buy school supplies for two of her children as well as rice and oil for the entire family.

loans.use: to buy flashlights

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel de 37 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, carismática, con ganas de superación,   es conviviente con Richard, quien es empleado y padre de 3 hermosos hijos de 16,11 y 2 años de edad a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración para seguir adelante. Viven en su casa propia lo cual lo construyo con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Isabel es la venta de ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, para toda ocasión, lo cual lo realiza desde su casa propia, siendo muy solicitada por los vecinos de la zona, amistades y familiares por su trato amable y cordial al momento a tender, y la calidad de sus prendas.
Esta actividad lo empezó con su propio capital, todos los productos se los envía un familiar de la capital ahorrándose ella gastos de viaje y obteniendo mayor ganancia.
Esta actividad lo viene realizando  sola hace más de  6 años tiempo en el cual llegó a hacerse conocida, logrando hacer crecer su cartera de clientes habituales.
Asimismo, considera su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda de sus productos llegando a vender todo lo que tiene disponible. 
Por otro lado, comenta que se inició en éste negocio por el deseo de contar con un ingreso propio, sentirse independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su pareja, así como el poder apoyarlo con los gastos del hogar. Logrando buenos resultados, espera que su negocio crezca y ella ser una prospera empresaria. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Comenta estar agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas con lo ha venido haciendo en los créditos anteriores, así tener un buen record crediticio y acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con el trabajo de su banco comunal  por el apoyo que brindan a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles los invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de su mercadería, como ropas de diversas tallas y modelos, para damas, caballeros y niños, también en calzados de damas. Toda está mercadería la comprará en volumen, buscando precios bajos por sus compas, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Isabel, 37, is a charismatic and enterprising woman who has a desire to succeed.  She lives with Richard, who is employed and is the father of her 3 beautiful children aged 16, 11 and 2.  She loves her children very much, and they are her inspiration to get ahead.  They live in their own home which was built with the help of her partner.  Isabel has a business selling clothing for all occasions for women, men and children.  She has this business in her own home, and it has been in great demand by her neighbors, friends and relatives because of her friendly and cordial service and the quality of her garments.  

She started this business with her own capital.  A relative sends her all of her products from the capital city, and this saves her travel expenses so that she can have greater profits.

She has been running this business on her own for more than 6 years, over which time her business has become well-known and she has managed to increase her customer base.

Furthermore, she considers her business to be quite profitable.  She gets a good income, and generally manages to sell out all of her products.

She comments that she started this business because she wanted to have her own income, feel independent and not have to depend on her partner's income.  She also wanted to be able to contribute to the household expenses.  Having had good results, she hopes that her business will grow and that she will become a prosperous businesswoman.  This will be her 10th loan with the MFP institution.  She comments that she is grateful for the opportunity to be able to access a line of credit to realize her plans.  As such, she is committed to making her payments, as she has done in the previous loans she has taken.  This way she can sustain a good credit rating and access more loans in the future.  Also, she comments that she is very comfortable working in her communal bank because of the support that they provide to people.  With the sum of 1,500 Peruvian soles requested, she will invest in all types of merchandise, such as clothing in a variety of sizes and styles for women, men and children.  She will also buy women's shoes.  She will buy all of this merchandise in bulk, seeking out the lowest prices for her purchases so that she can have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es: El señor Emiliano, es agricultor de zona de la concepcion, junto a su familia, los planes hacia un futuro es poder mejorar las condicones de vida, don Emiliano agradece el apoyo que le brinda afodenic atravez  de los fondos Kiva, ya que gracias a los financimientos a obtenidos mejores resultados y a la vez con el poco dinero que le quedaba de ganancia logro preparar a unas de sus hijas que ahora es enfermera.Espera en Dios que le sigan apoyando y si tener algun dia una mejor condicion de vida con todo su familia .El necesita el financimiento para la compra defertilizantes e insumos para aplicar fetilizantes e insumos a una manzana de café .
texts.en:
Emiliano, a farmer from the Concepcion zone, together with his family, has plans for a better future, hoping to improve his family's standard of living. He thanks Afodenic for helping with access to Kiva funds. Thanks to financing already obtained, better results were obtained and, in addition, with the little money remaining from his earnings, he was able to educate one his daughters who is now a nurse.

Emiliano hopes that God will continue to help him so that one day, he will enjoy a better condition of life with all his family. At present, he needs financing to buy fertilizers and inputs to apply to his 1 manzana (1.75 acres) of coffee trees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his 1.75 acres of coffee trees.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her mid thirties, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been running a beauty salon for seven years. She works from 9.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to open a beauty salon, sell ladies and children clothes, pay school fees and has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to open a food market. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "KISIWANI" who has a total of fifteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to open a food market.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is aged forty and has been in farming for ten years. She currently employs one farmhand, and her farm produces milk. She also runs an agro-veterinary business. 

Jackline has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to improve her agrovet business. She says the agrovet business will lower her costs of dairy treatment and improve her income allowing her to give her family better living standards.

Jackline is glad her life will be better with access to Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy agro-veterinary products.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica is aged fifty-five and married with six adult children. She has been in the farming business for thirty years, in her early years, she mainly grew coffee. She is currently producing coffee and maize for the local market. She hopes to boost her farming business. 

Angelica has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will help improve her family living standards by giving milk for their daily consumption as well as improving her business. She emphasizes improved income will make her more independent.

Her challenge remains high costs of inputs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is fifty-two years old, married to Rose, and they have two children who are in school.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his sixth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides for the farm.

He hopes to venture into the cattle rearing business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Dovya Group

texts.en:
Shukuru, who is in her late thirties is married with one child who is also married. She has been running a beauty salon for 20 years now.  She works from 9.00 am to 7.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the equipment in her salon, renovate the salon by painting the inside, repair the floor by putting down tiles and installing a washing sink, and pay household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase the equipment in the salon and to pay the rent. Her dream is to one day be able to modify her house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "DOVYA" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase equipment in the salon and to pay the rent for the salon.

loans.name: Randa

texts.en: Randa is a 25-year-old married lady. She has been working in her beauty salon for the last three years and she is planning to enhance the salon by adding new services and renewing the decoration. But now Randa has applied for a loan to renew the salon’s official registration.

loans.use: to renew the salon’s official registration.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa, 46 years old, is a widow. She was left with six sons and daughters to support. Sharifa started making baskets from straw to sell to support her family. It has been six years since she started and now she wants to start selling additional products such as home products to increase the family income. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to buy the goods she wants to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is a resident of Murang’a  and lives with her young family of two children aged eleven and two. She is twenty-eight and has been involved actively in farming for eighteen years. She farms coffee, tea, maize and horticultural products for the local market.

Sicily has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her cereals business by buying pesticides and expanding her store. She adds she will later use the income to buy more land to further improve her farming to include other products that can withstand harsh weather conditions.

She laments of high costs of pesticides to keep the produce safe.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and expand her cereals store.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a mother of three children aged fourteen, eight and three. She has been in farming for ten years producing and selling milk, maize and beans for the local market. Alice is aged thirty-four.

Alice has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. She says the venture will give her the income to educate her children as well as expand her business and supply both local and external markets. This is her second loan after the first one of 30,000 KES.

She is glad Juhudi Kilimo loans have helped her achieve her dream of making farming into a business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter, a married father of a nine-year-old, lives in Murang’a, Central Kenya where he has been farming and producing coffee, maize, beans and milk for five years, employing one farmhand. All of his products, save for a small amount of milk consumed by his family, is sold to the local market. Lack of capital and dry spells are his major business challenges.

Peter has requested a loan of 53,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the resulting additional income will improve his family's living standard. His goal is to have five dairy cows.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 37-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married with 6 children between the ages of 2 and 17. Four of them go to school. 

Felix runs a mixed goods' store and he has been in the business for 5 years. He has no employees. Felix heard about Finance Sudan through its fellow clients, as well promotion done in the market by the loan officers.

He is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase more items like sugar, sweets, nomi, cooking oil and many other items. In addition to this business, Felix has a motorcycle used for bodaboda as another source of income.

In 5 years' time, Felix would like to build a better house and increase his number of motorcycles to two. His major challenges include a low income rate and paying school fees. 
 
Felix says that he really appreciated Finance South Sudan for the good work done and its work should not end; it should continue.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, sweets, nomi, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be an intelligent woman. She operates a farm where she sells peas, potatoes, etc. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for expanding the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more seeds for planting before March season comes. Lilian's business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Peng

texts.en:
Peng, a responsible mother of three lovely young children, lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is a pig-raiser and has a life partner who works as a public school teacher in a local high school.

Peng is preparing to construct her house but needs some funds from our firm, HKL, to supplement her existing capital to purchase timber for the construction. This will be her fifth loan with HKL and her first with Kiva. She hopes to get a quick response from our lenders. She is an honest client who repays her loans regularly and punctually. All previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to purchase timber for house construction.

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person, so she has asked her brother-in-law to take her place in the photo. Abeer, 26 years old, is a housewife and a mother of three children.

Her husband has a trading business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Recently, he has built a tent for selling those fruits and vegetables. His wife Abeer has applied for a loan to help her husband expanding the business and build more tents in other places.

loans.use: to build more tents

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha, 43 years old and married, has five children. She is married to Mohammad who is a police officer. After she retired from working in a telecommunications company, Maha has started to make different shaped baskets, trays and even tables using straw. She has applied for a loan to buy more material needed for the crafts she makes so she can increase her productivity and therefore increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make crafts

loans.name: Adita

texts.es:
Adita, de 29 años de edad, es una joven mujer luchadora y trabajadora, no le teme al trabajo y tiene muchas ilusiones para su futuro. Es separada del padre de sus 2 hijos: María y Santiago de 10 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente la casa de su madre en compañía de su mamá y su papá. La actividad que realiza Adita es la elaboración y venta de esteras que sirven para las divisiones y paredes de las casas, hechos  a base de desperdicios de triplay. Cuenta con un local alquilado donde tiene todos los materiales necesarios para el proceso de elaboración, además de personal que le ayuda que son 3 ayudantes a quienes paga por día trabajado. Luego los vende a base de pedidos al por mayor y menor, atendiendo puntual y amablemente a sus clientes.
 Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio  que fue reinvirtiendo, y hasta el momento le apoya su hermana en la administración y consiguiendo nuevos  clientes.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda y las buenas ganancias que le deja ya que cuenta con varios pedidos por entregar.
Decidió empezar con su negocio por el deseo de ser independiente y contar con sus propios ingresos económicos, además que le ayudó cuando se separó de su pareja y no contaba con su apoyo para asumir los gastos de sus hijos, logrando luego que le diera una pensión para sus hijos.
En la actualidad, viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo, quiere continuar con su negocio y aumentar su producción. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP. Esta agradecida de contar con una línea de crédito, podrá sentirse más segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta estar contenta con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1300 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus esteras, como desperdicios de triplay que compra en las fábricas cercanas, buscando precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en:
Adita, 29, is a hard-working young woman.  She's not afraid of work and has high hopes for her future.  She is separated from the father of her 2 children, Maria, 10, and Santiago, 5.  Adita and her children live with her father and mother.  Adita operates a business making and selling plyboard dividers.  Customers use the dividers to create temporary walls.  She rents a space where she makes the dividers and hires day laborers to help.  She sells to both wholesalers and retailers and she's committed to delivering all orders on time.  Adita used her own money to start the business 5 years ago.  Her sister helps her with admistrative work and sales, and the business is now profitable.
Adita decided to start the business because she wanted an income of her own and she needed the business to support her children when she separated from her husband.  She wants to grow the business now.  
Adita has borrowed from MFP once before and she is grateful to the bank for helping her grow her business.  She tells us that she likes her community bank and that its members are responsible and supportive.  
Adita will use this 1300 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of  materials for making the product she sells.

loans.use: to buy materials for making plyboard dividers.

loans.name: Luzdina

texts.es:
Luzdina, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ansias de progresar, además es alegre y sociable, le gustan los negocios. Es separada del padre de sus 4 hijos que son: Rocío de 22, Nara de 20, Mayra de 16 y Christian de 14 años de edad. Todos instalados cómodamente en su propia casa que compró con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Luzdina es la venta de pescado fresco por las  mañanas, empieza por las madrugadas dirigiéndose al puesto de la localidad a comprar su mercadería de los pescadores, luego los lleva a su puesto de venta en el mercado Bellavista, donde los prepara y vende, atendiendo muy bien a sus clientes sabiendo que de esa manera le seguirán comprando en el futuro.
Se inició hace más de 4 años con un capital propio, viendo que un trabajo de fácil realización y bastante demanda, viendo rotar  y aumentar su capital de manera diaria ya que generalmente  acaba lo que lleva para la venta y hasta el momento le apoyan ocasionalmente sus hijas mayores en la ventas..
Antes de iniciar su negocio, tenía problemas económicos ya que  se había separado del padre de sus hijos y con la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico ya que con la pensión que recibía por sus hijas no les alcanzaba, entonces  se decidió a empezar a vender.
Viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, espera  ver crecer su negocio, aumentando su capital. Este será el préstamo número 7 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida por saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para avanzar con sus planes. Por otro lado se siente a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pescado fresco en mayor volumen y buscando menos precios. Además de realizar arreglos en su casa para abrir otro negocio de una bodega de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Forty-one year old Luzdina, is a woman who eagerly wants to progress in her life, furthermore she is happy and sociable and likes running a business. She is separated from the father of her four children who are: Rocío, 22; Nara, 20; Mayra, 16 and Christian, 14; All of them live comfortably in her house, which she bought with much effort.

Luzdina sells fresh fish in the mornings. She starts at daybreak, by going to the fish market to buy directly from the fishermen. Later, she takes the fish to her own fish stand in the Bellavista market, where she prepares them for sale. She gives her customers very good service, knowing that in this way, they will keep buying from her in the future. 

She began more than four years ago with her own capital, seeing that it would be easy to start and that there was enough demand. Seeing the rotation and increasing her capital each day, because she generally sells what she brings to the market and up til now, her oldest daughters occasionally help her in the market. Before she started her business, she had economic problems because she had separated from the father of her children and needed to have an income because the pension she received for her children was not enough, so she decided to start selling fish.

Seeing the good results she has had, she hopes to grow her business and increase her capital. This is will be her seventh loan with MFP. She is grateful to know that she can count on the financial support to advance her business plans. On the other hand, she feels comfortable with her communal bank and she considers it a unified and supportive group. The loan requested is 3,000 nuevos soles and she will invest it in the purchase of wholesale fresh fish and will seek it for lower prices. Furthermore, she would like to arrange her house to be able to open another business, a grocery store.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be ambitious, energetic and generous. He operates a business where he provides vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for 16 years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are drivers and vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of spare parts. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Paul's business goal and dream is to own 3 motor vehicles within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for vehicle repair business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells motor vehicle spare parts. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a bus station and her primary customers are drivers and vehicle owners. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of spare parts, making it difficult to meet her customers' needs. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more spare parts. Susan's business dream and hope is to run another spare parts' retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: 3.9.131.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Điệp Dương operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

Điệp Dương is 38 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 3.9.131.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2010, Điệp Dương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her child to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada, además de ser amable y sociable. Está casada con Acsel quien es empleado y es padre de sus 2 hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de su suegro. La actividad que realiza María es el alquiler de juegos de entretenimiento para adultos como el billar, para eso cuenta con un local habilitado en su propia casa, donde tiene 4 mesas disponibles. Iniciándose por idea de su pareja y con un capital propio fruto de sus ahorros. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio, contando con el apoyo de su suegro en la atención a los clientes de manera amable y cordial. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera  los ingresos económicos necesarios para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de sentirse una persona productiva. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene, pues le llega a faltar mesas. Por eso, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y comprar al menos 2 mesas más, además que incluir otro negocio de venta de comidas rápidas. Este será el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le gusta el trabajo que viene realizando, brindando oportunidad de créditos a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos, soles lo invertirá en la compra de algunas mesas más para generarse más ingresos económicos, además de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas rápidas.
texts.en:
Maria, 36 years old, is a hard-working and dedicated woman, who, in addition, is very nice and sociable. She is married to Acsel who is employed and is the father of their 2 children, aged 11 and 8. They live in their own house with her father-in-law.

Maria's activity is renting out entertainment games such as billiards to adults. To do this, she has furnished a room in her house in which there are now 4 available tables. The idea was her husband's and she started with capital drawn from their savings. She has had the business for a little more than 1 year, with help from her father-in-law who attends to customers in a kind and cordial way.

Maria likes her business, which generates income necessary to help the couple with household expenses, and it makes her feel like a productive person. She considers her business sufficiently profitable, thanks to demand, but she needs more tables. For that reason, Maria plans to expand her business and buy at least 2 more tables, and also, to include another business selling quick meals.

This will be her 5th loan through MFP, and she hopes with this collaboration, to continue towards her objectives. Besides, she comments that she feels good about her communal bank, and she likes the work that it continues to achieve, offering opportunities for loans to individuals. With the solicited amount of 1,500 new sols, she will buy more billiard tables to generate more earnings, plus the ingredients for preparing quick meals to sell.

loans.use: to buy more billiard tables plus ingredientes to begin making and selling quick meals.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 1 year to 4 years. She describes herself to be a self-motivated woman. She operates a motorcycle, which she uses to provide motorcycle transportation services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a potential business environment and her primary customers are office employees and local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor infrastructure. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. Miriam's business goal and hope is to own several motorcycles within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: 07-Pt2-01-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liễu has a service business providing housing rentals. She is requesting a loan to purchase bricks, lime, and building houses for rent.

Liễu is 48 years old and she is married with 4 children. Liễu is the group leader of the 07-PT2-02-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

In 2011, Liễu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liễu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Liễu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Liễu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liễu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, lime, and building houses for rent

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 28 years old and she lives in Airport community. She stopped her education in the 2nd grade. She is married and has two children, aged 3 and 6. One is not in school, while the older one attends school and both of them live at home. She received money from her husband to start her business. For 10 years now, Felecia has been operating a mini-shop where she sells soap, rice, toothpaste and many other items. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, and many items for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, and many items for her business

loans.name: 07-Pt3-03-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, duck, spices and vegetables for making the soup she sells. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Hoa is 49 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 07-PT3-03-Phú Sơn solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents. With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, duck, spices and vegetables for making the soup she sells.

loans.name: 07-Pt2-05-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Sáu has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase candy and biscuits to resell. Sáu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Sáu is 63 years old and she is single with 4 children. She is the group leader of the 07-PT2-05-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. With her business profit, Sáu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase candy and biscuits to resell.

loans.name: Siphan

texts.en:
Siphon and her husband, Chantha Heng, both age 43, live in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are garment workers and the youngest is in school. 

Siphan is a homemaker. The main source of income comes from the salaries earned by her husband and children. Her husband is a soldier. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 in order to purchase a motorbike to serve as transportation for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es: Amparo, de 39 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y empeñosa, buscando salir adelante. Está casada con Ronald quien es empleado y padre de sus 3 hijos de 18, 12 y 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Ampara es la venta de comidas rápidas como pollos broster, alitas fritas, salchipapas y otros.  Para esto instala todas las noches en el frontis de su casa su carrito sanguchero más dos mesas con sus sillas, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, ganándose sus preferencias. Tiene más de 6 años dedicándose a éste negocio contando con el apoyo de su hija mayor en la atención a los clientes. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos, además de gustarle la cocina, y el poder apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes en continuar con su negocio e incursionar en la venta de pollo a la brasa abriendo un local alquilado. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal por el apoyo que vienen recibiendo para avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comida rápida como aceites, harina, pollos entre otros, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras al contado.
texts.en: Amparo, who is 39 years old, is a determined and hard-working woman, looking to get ahead.  She is married to Ronald, who is employed and the father of their 3 children who are 18, 12, and 2 years old.  They live comfortably together in their own home.  Amparo works in the sales of fast foods like broasted chicken, fried wings, "salchipapas" [fried hot dogs and french fries], and other things.  She sets up her cart every night in front of her house along with two tables with their chairs, where she attends very nicely to her customers, making their orders.  She has more than 6 years of experience in this business, counting on her eldest daughter's support in serving the customers.  She likes her business because of the economic income.  Furthermore, she likes the kitchen, and having the ability to support her husband with the household costs.  She thinks that her business is fairly profitable because of the good earnings that it gives her.  As such, she has plans to continue with her business and to begin selling grilled chicken, opening a rented location.  This will be her 11th loan with the MFP institution.  Therefore, she expects their collaboration so that she can finalize her plans.  Besides, she mentions feeling pleased with her communal bank because of the support that they receive to advance with their business.  With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to prepare the fast food such as oil, flour, chicken, and other items,  looking for the lowest prices for her cash purchases.

loans.use: buy oils, flour, and chicken meat.

loans.name: Ruqaya

texts.en:
Ruqaya is a conservative person so she has asked her brother Mohammad to take her place in the photo.

Ruqaya is 30 years old and single. She works with her brother in a tailoring workshop to support the family and help in improving their living conditions. Ruqaya has applied for a loan to buy more fabric to sell and to use in making clothes and other items.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: 07-Pt2-06-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Đậu works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase pigs to raise and resell.

Đậu is 52 years old and she is single with 4 children. Đậu is the group leader of the 07-PT2-06-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

In 2011, Đậu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Đậu has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Đậu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Đậu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Đậu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and resell

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 34-year-old young woman. She is married and a mother with two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a worker who gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover the family's needs.

For the past five years, Hala has a workshop for tailoring clothes. She is well-known to customers and the owners of clothing stores, which helped her to have a profitable project for the family.

Hala is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing needed textiles and threads to tailor clothes that customers request. This will increase sales and improve the family's income. 

Hala is photographed in her workshop while she is tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase textiles and threads

loans.name: 07-Pt2-08-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngoan has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth to sew clothes for people in her community. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Ngoan is 32 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 07-PT2-08-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 9 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent. With her business profit, Ngoan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sew clothes for her community.

loans.name: 07-Pt3-02-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase chicken, duck and fruit to resell. She is 39 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Thủy is the group leader of the 07-PT3-02-Phú Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 3 dependents. With her business profit, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: To purchase chicken, duck and fruit to resell.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet, age 51, pictured here at her home, is a widow with two sons. She lives in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. One son is a garment worker and the other attends school.

Yet is a rice farmer. She is applying for her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorcycle for her son, who is a garment worker, to get to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her son, who is a garment worker, to get to work

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es:
Lleny, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que le gusta el trabajo, además de ser alegre y sociable. Es conviviente con Juan quien es comerciante y padre de sus 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 3 de ellos, Katherine, Junior, Fiorella, de 19, 16 y 8  años de edad respectivamente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa que  compraron con el fruto de su esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Lleny es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de variados sabores y marcas, haciéndolas helar al gusto de sus clientes, para eso cuenta con un refrigeradora que compró con un préstamo y la instaló en su casa, desde allí  los atiende de manera amable y cordial, sabiendo que con ese trato se ganara la preferencia de sus clientes. 
Se inició con un préstamo de MFP, que le sirvió para realizar sus primeras compras, viendo la acogida que tuvo su negocio y con las ganancias que le dejaba los reinvirtió logrando comprar en mayores cantidades, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y por el consumo constante de las bebidas por lo caluroso de la zona.
Antes de empezar con su negocio, nos comenta que no tenía problemas, pero si el deseo de contar con una ocupación que la distrajera, además como contar con sus propios ingresos, así apoyar a su pareja con los gastos y no depender totalmente de él.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio y aumentar su mercadería para ver crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP. Está agradecida con la oportunidad de contar con un apoyo financiero, así se sentirá más segura para avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, comenta le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal que viene apoyando a las personas con una línea de crédito para concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 2500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de su mercadería para tener un stock disponible para la venta, así ver crecer su negocio, buscando precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Lleny, 43, is a friendly, hard-working woman.  She and her partner, Juan, have 4 children, 3 of whom still live at home: Katherine, 19, Junion, 16, and Firorella, 8.  They live in a house that they worked hard to build.  Lleny operates a business buying and selling all kinds of soft drinks.  She keeps the drinks in a refrigerator that she bought to keep them cold.  Her customers want cold drinks and she provides them.  She's friendly and cordial because her customers want that too.  
Lleny started the business with an MFP loan and it was successful from the start.  She then used her profits to buy larger quantities of soft drinks.  She runs the business alone and says that it's profitable.  There's a lot of demand for cold drinks here because of the hot climate.
Lleny says that she didn't have any particular reason for starting the business.  She wanted something to do and a way to help her partner with household expenses.  She likes having an income of her own, though, and she wants to grow the business now.  
This will be Lleny's 11th MFP loan and she is grateful to the bank for helping her grow her business.  She tells us that she likes her community bank because they help borrowers turn their plans into reality.  
Lleny will use this 2500 new soles loan to buy wholesale supplies of soft drinks for her drinks business.

loans.use: to stock her soft drinks business.

loans.name: Yaseen

texts.en:
Yaseen is 39 years old and married. He has two daughters and his wife is a housewife. 

Fourteen years ago, Yaseen opened a small grocery store and has worked on enhancing it through the years. Now Yaseen has applied for a loan in order to bring all types of necessary grocery items to the store so the customer can find everything he wants in the store.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is a 55-year-old illiterate woman who works in a school. Her husband owns a small grocery store. Noura has applied for a loan to help in supporting her husband’s business so he can fill the store with more grocery items to attract and serve more customers in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to fill the store with more grocery items

loans.name: 07-Pt2-04-Phú Sơn Group

texts.en:
