Ahmad is a 24-year-old single guy. He lives with his parents and his four siblings.

Ahmad opened his own shop for selling mobile phones and phone accessories. This was five years ago. Now Ahmad has applied for a youth loan to increase his shop inventory of phones and phone accessories.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is a 28-year-old single guy. He has lived with his mother in a rented apartment since his father passed away. 

Being responsible for his mother led him to open a shop for selling mobile phones and accessories a year ago. Now he has applied for a youth loan to bring in more mobiles and increase his inventory to make more profit.

loans.use: to bring in more mobiles and increase his inventory

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman, a 23-year-old single lady, lives with her mother and two siblings; their father passed away. 

Iman is a university student in her last year, majoring in civil engineering. She has applied for a loan to pay for the semester's fees so she can graduate and find a suitable job to help her family in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the semester's school fees

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa, 22 years old and a single lady, is the oldest among four brothers and sisters.

Arwa is studying the English language at the university; she wants to become a teacher after graduation. She has applied for a loan to pay her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim, a 22-year-old single guy, is the oldest among his eight siblings. 

Ibrahim works in a shop making sweets; he is also a student in one of the Jordanian colleges majoring in accounting. Ibrahim uses his salary to cover his daily expenses and to pay his semester’s fees.

After getting his diploma from the college, he intends to continue to get a Bachelor's degree in the same major. Unfortunately, Ibrahim was not able to save for his next semester fees due to some family issues, so he has applied for a loan in order to pay the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour, 20 years old and a single lady, is living with her parents and siblings. She is the oldest among four brothers and sisters. Her father is a self-employed taxi driver.

Nour is a university student majoring in finance and banking. Since she is the oldest, Nour wants to graduate as soon as she can so she can help her father to get all of her siblings into colleges.

She has applied for a loan in order to pay her semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester’s fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man. He has five brothers and sisters.
Mohammad is a university student in his last year of studying chemistry. He hopes that after graduation he will find a job in the field. Mohammad has applied for a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 22-year-old single man. He is the oldest of five siblings.
Thaer is a computer science student in his third year at university. To be able to support the family, Thaer's father started to work as a taxi driver after his retirement. Thaer wants to continue his studies but because of a shortage of money he has applied for a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 51-year-old housewife and a mother of six sons and daughters.
Majeda used to work for the Ministry of Education before she retired; her husband has also retired from one of the governmental entities. They use their retirement salaries, and are helped by their eldest child who works as a male nurse to support the family. 
Now one of their daughters has entered university, and Majeda wants to make sure that she finishes and graduates in order to start working in her field. For this purpose, Majeda has applied for a loan in order to pay her daughter's semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's semester fees.

loans.name: Adham

texts.en:
Adham is a 21-year-old single guy, He has three brothers and one sister.

Adham wanted to study, so he started working in a hospital to save up money. He registered in the University to study Economics. But Adham faced a money shortage when he went to pay for the fee, so he has applied for a loan in order to do so.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Musaab

texts.en:
Musaab, a 21 years old single guy, lives with his parents in Al Karak, a city southern Jordan.

Musaab, is studying Tourism in one of the Jordanian Universities. He has applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees so he can graduate as soon as possible and find a job to support his parents and himself.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 20-year-old single man. He is the eldest among his five brothers and sisters.

Nimer is an IT student at one of the Jordanian universities, making his way to graduation and after that, higher education studies in the same field. 

He has applied for a loan now to pay for his registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his registration fees.

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a conservative person, so she asked her son Ammar to take the photo instead.

Suad, a 44-year-old married lady, is married to a driver. They have three sons and a daughter.

One of their sons, Ammar, who is the eldest, is studying applied physics in the university to become a physics teacher in the future. His mother, Suad, has applied for this loan in order to pay for her son’s semester fees so he can continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, a 23-year-old single man, is the youngest of his four siblings.

Mohammad is a student in a private university, trying to get a bachelor's degree, so he applied for a loan to pay for his semester’s fees.

Mohammad hopes that after graduation he will find a suitable job that can provide him with a good salary and a good experience for his future.

loans.use: to pay for his semester’s fees.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Because Sawsan is a conservative person, she asked her son Qusai to take the photo instead.

Sawsan is a 48-year-old married lady. She has three sons and a daughter.

Sawsan has two sons studying in the university; one of them is Qusai who appears in the photo. He is majoring in planning and managerial studies. The other one, Ahmad, has joined the military and is studying accounting on the side.

Sawsan has applied for a loan to pay for both of her sons’ semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for both of her sons’ semester fees.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a conservative person, so she asked her brother Khaled to appear in the photo instead of her. 

Nour is a 21-year-old single lady who wants to support her brother Khaled in his studies and help him to graduate. Khaled works as a cashier in one of the largest malls in Amman, he also is a university student majoring in accounting systems. 

Nour has applied for this loan to help him pay the registration fees for the university so he can continue his education.

loans.use: To pay for her brother's semester's fees.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a conservative person, so she asked her daughter to appear in the photo instead. 

Amal is a 46-year-old housewife. She is married to Mohammad, who works for the Ministry of Education. Amal and her husband have six sons and daughters; one of their daughters is married. 

Her second daughter Ansam, who appears in the photo, is a university student majoring in Marketing, which is a field that she loves and wants to work in. 

Amal wants to help her husband and her daughter, so she has applied for a loan to pay for the fees for a semester at the university.

loans.use: to pay for a semester at the university for her daughter

loans.name: Qusai

texts.en:
Qusai is a 22-year-old single guy. His mother is a housewife, and his father is a translator. 

Qusai is a second year student in the university majoring in Business Administration; he is also in his last year to get a diploma in Mechanics. With his ambitious and hard work Qusai is now looking forward to getting his bachelor degree and starting work in the field to apply what he studied and gain experience. 

He has applied for loan to pay the semester's fees at the university.

loans.use: to pay the fees for a semester at the university

loans.name: Waad

texts.en:
Waad, 22 years old, is a single lady. She lives with her parents and three siblings.

Waad is an accounting student at one of the Jordanian universities. Since she is the oldest, she wants to study hard to be a good role model for her siblings and she wants to find a good job in the future to apply what she has studied. 

Waad has applied for a loan to pay for her semester’s fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester’s fees

loans.name: Siham

texts.en:
Siham is a conservative person so she asked her daughter Sabaa to take her place in the photo.

Siham, a 50-year-old housewife, is married to Zuhair who has recently retired from the military. They have six sons and daughters.

Her eldest Sabaa, a 19-year-old single lady, is a managerial student at the university. She is still a new student hoping to graduate as soon as possible and be a good role model for the rest of her siblings. 
 
Siham has applied for a loan to pay for her daughter’s university fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university fees

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is a 26-year-old divorced lady and the mother of one boy.
 
Since Ahlam is depending on herself to survive life and to support her child, she insists on continuing to get a Bachelor's degree to find a more suitable job for her. At the same time, Ahlam works at two jobs. One of the jobs is a secretary in a lawyer’s office. The other is in her small food shop in the neighborhood where she sells kid's snacks and candy.  

Ahlam has now applied for a loan to pay for her semester fees since she is in the last year before graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Bashar

texts.en:
Bashar is 21 years old and single. He is a university student studying Managerial Information Systems. Because of his financial circumstances, Bashar wants to graduate as soon as possible to help with the family's financial situation.
 
He has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees to get his Bachelors degree as soon as he can.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en: Asmaa, a 24-year-old married lady, has two children. Her husband works for the government. Asmaa wants to provide her kids with the best life she can offer them, so she decided to work hard to achieve that. She started to make pickles to sell:  pepper pickles, cucumber pickles, olive pickles, lemon pickles and others. Now Asmaa has applied for a youth loan to add new kinds of pickles from other vegetables.

loans.use: to add new kinds of pickles from other vegetables

loans.name: Banaz

texts.en:
Banaz is a 22 years old, married, young Iraqi woman. She has been using her sewing skills for 4 years as a means to help out with supporting her family. 

In the past she successfully applied, received, and repaid a Relief International Microfinance Iraq loan which she used for buying a small generator to allow her to work during the hours when the city had no electricity. 

Banaz took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 2700 USD to renew her work area and purchase more fabric and raw materials. 

Banaz is 22, and qualifies for a 'youth loan'.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area and purchase more fabric and raw materials.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 20-year-old single lady. She has two younger brothers. Her father is a teacher.
Now that Ruba has entered the university, she has chosen to study English literature. She is now in her second year, and would like to continue to get her bachelor's degree and get a master's degree in the same field.
Ruba has applied for a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Sadiya

texts.en:
Sadiya is a conservative person, so she asked her son Waheeb to take her place in the photo.
Sadiya is a 64-year-old widow. She has six sons and daughters. One of them is Waheeb, a 33-year-old single man. He is the oldest among the men in the family.
Due to some financial challenges, Waheeb was not able to register to study at the university when he was at a younger age, but he kept working hard until one day, he was accepted to study architecture. Now he is in his second year and is very close to getting a diploma in the major, but he wants to proceed to get a bachelor's degree and work in the same field in order to help in supporting his younger brothers and sisters to get a chance at learning.
Now, Sadiya wants to help her son Waheeb to achieve his goal, so she has applied for a loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Because Arwa is a conservative woman, she asked her son Hamzah to take her place.
Arwa is a 47-year-old married woman. She has five sons and daughters. Her eldest is Hamzah, a 21-year-old single man. He is a university student majoring in chemistry. 
Hamzah wants to graduate as soon as possible to help his father in supporting the family by finding a job in the same field. In order to do so, his mother, Arwa, has applied for a loan to pay for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester

loans.name: Daifallah

texts.en:
Daifallah is a  23-year-old single guy who is in the fourth year of studying Business Information Systems. 

Daifallah is one of five sons and daughters for Ghaleb and Siham who have worked hard to provide their children with a good life. That’s why Daifallah decided to depend on himself and started to work in a café on specific shifts based on his university schedule. 

Daifallah has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his semester as he has faced money shortage this time.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees

loans.name: Sope Serign Mbacké Sokhna Lo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Sope Serign Mbacké Sokhna Lo a été crée depuis le premier cycle  du BV. Il regroupe actuellement 7 membres habitant le même village et s'activant dans le petit commerce comme activité principale

Madame Astou (debout à gauche de la photo) est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants.

Elle développe une activité de petit commerce de céréales depuis plusieurs années

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va se procurer de la marchandise (arachide et mil) qu 'elle va revendre au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à payer les fournitures scolaires pour ses enfants mais également des habits lors des fêtes religieuses.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Serigan Mbacké Sokhna Lo has been in existence since the first cycle of the banc villageois. It is currently comprised of seven members who live in the same village and who engage in small trade as their primary activity. 

Madame Astou (standing at the left in the photo) is responsible for the solidarity group. She is 63 years old, married, and the mother of 9 children. For several years she has been developing a small business trading grains. With her new loan, she will procure merchandise (peanuts and millet) which she will resell at the small market in her village.

With these profits she will be able to pay for her children's school supplies as well as for clothing for religious festivals.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts and millet

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, de 26 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 1 año, todos los días ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y a mejorar la economía de su familia, vive en su casa propia con su pareja y su menor hijo. El trabajo de Sandra consiste en la venta de prendas de vestir, si alguien en la cuadra de su casa necesita alguna prenda de vestir para poder asistir a algún evento social o familiar, siempre van en busca de ella que tiene la prenda adecuada para cualquier ocasión. Tiene un pequeño espacio en su casa en donde acondicionó para atender a sus diferentes clientes. Trabaja ya por dos años en éste negocio y lo hace sola ya que así se siente mas cómoda.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener ingresos, al mismo tiempo que tiene espacio para cuidar a su menor hijo, asimismo le hace sentir muy útil ya que aporta en la economía de su hogar. Ella como toda mujer decidida y emprendedora tiene muchos planes a futuro y desea tener una tienda en donde pueda ofrecer las diferentes prendas que tiene de una manera mas cómoda y con mayor acceso al público. Este será el segundo crédito con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará más prendas de vestir pues desea siempre tener en stock por si algún cliente necesite, además de tener todo a la moda. También se comprará una maquina de coser ya que desea empezar a coser sus propios diseños.
texts.en:
26-year-old Sandra is a nice, kind, hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner and the couple have a 1-year-old son.  Every day, Sandra works hard as she would like to provide her son with a better quality of life and improve her family's financial situation.  She lives in her own home together with her partner and son.

Sandra's business is selling clothing.  If anybody on her block needs to buy any clothing to attend a social or family event, they always seek her out because she has suitable garments for any occasion.  She has a small space in her house which she set up to serve her customers in.  Sandra has been in this business for two years now and works alone as she feels more comfortable that way.  She enjoys her business because it makes her income and also allows her to care for her son.  At the same time, it makes her feel very useful as she is contributing financially towards her household.  In common with all determined and entrepreneurial women, Sandra has many plans for the future.  She would like to have a store where she can offer the different clothing that she sells in more comfort and with better access to the public.

This will be Sandra's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue achieving her goals.  For her part, she pledges, once again, to make her repayments on time, as she did with her previous loans.  She enjoys being a member of her community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Sandra will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy more clothing as she would like to always have items in stock in case any customer should need them.  She also likes to ensure her stock is fashionable.  In addition, Sandra will buy a sewing machine as she would like to start sewing her own designs.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and a sewing machine

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío, de 43 años, es una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora, tiene muchas ganas de progresar, ella es madre de dos menores hijas con quienes vive en casa propia junto a su esposo con quien lleva varios años de casada. Rocío tiene como trabajo la venta de golosinas y postres y lo realiza en la puerta de su casa, además tiene varios cuartos en su casa los cuales alquila, por lo que significa un ingreso mas para su economía. Lleva en éste trabajo diez años, lo hace en su casa y tiene la ayuda de sus hijas, aunque por el momento la venta de dulces no lo está haciendo muy seguido, pues el clima en la zona no le permite completar exitosamente su venta, pero ella como es una mujer de negocios ya esta viendo la manera de poder generar ganancias con otro tipo de inversión. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es que le da buenos ingresos, además de poder estar en su casa con sus hijas. Ella espera mas adelante mejorar las condiciones de su casa para así alquilar sus cuartos a mejor precio. Este será el tercer cerdito con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero ya que le permitirá estar mas tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse mas con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará materiales para construcción ya que comenzara con la ampliación de sus cuartos y mejorará las condiciones de los mismos.
texts.en:
Rocio, 43 years old, is a responsible, hard working woman who has a great desire to progress. She is the mother of two minor aged daughters who live with her in her own house together with her husband, to whom she has been married to for several years. Rocio works selling sweets and desserts, which she carries out from the door of her house. Also, she has various bedrooms which she rents out in order to have a higher income contributing to her economic situation. 

She has been working in this activity for ten years; she does it at home and has the help of her daughters. However, for the moment she is not carrying out the sales of sweets very regularly, as the climate in the area does not allow her to sell successfully. But as she is a business woman she has already found a way to generate more income with a different type of investment.

What she most enjoys about her work is being able to have a good income as well as being at home with her daughters. She hopes to improve the living conditions in her house in the future in order to rent out her rooms at a better price. This will be her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support as this will give her more tranquillity to advance with her plans for her business. She is committed to paying her quotas punctually and above all to associate with the other members of her communal bank as they are very supportive. With the loan amount of 1200 PEN she will buy construction materials as she will begin extending her rooms and improving the conditions they are in.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to prepare more rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín de 24 años convive con Errobelina con quien tiene 2 hijos: Sheyla de 7 y Yeysi de 3 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en la comunidad nativa Inchatingari, distrito de Perené, provincia de Chanchamayo.
Benjamín empezó su vida de padre en la adolescencia todavía con carencias de hogar y dinero. Con el tiempo y el apoyo de sus padres pudo acceder a terrenos de cultivos. Así conformó un hogar y construyó su casa. Actualmente cuenta con 3 parcelas de tierras fértiles, en ellas produce achiote y café.
“En una cosecha tengo 1500 kilos de achiote y del café como 300 kilos”, menciona. Benjamín negocia sus productos al menudeo. Traslada sus frutos hasta la ciudad de Pichanaki, ahí tiene un puesto de ventas donde ofrece el café y achiote por kilos. 
Lleva 5 años en esta actividad. Y confía que, con los años podrá ampliar sus terrenos cultivando otros productos. Además de comercializar al por mayor, ya que los resultados son inmediatos y se evita que los frutos se malogren.
Unos de sus planes es dedicarse a la compra y venta de frutas, que piensa adquirir en su localidad para expenderlas en el mercado mayorista de su distrito. Éste sería su crédito número3 que recibiría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el  pago de las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse respaldado con su banco comunal “Productores de Inchatingari”, porque sus compañeros comparten los mismos planes.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de herramientas de trabajo como machetes y limas, con las que cultivará sus cafetales. Además pagará a los jornaleros quienes apoyarán en esta ardua labor.
texts.en:
24-year-old Benjamín lives with his partner Errobelina.  The couple have two children: 7-year-old Sheyla and 3-year-old Yeysi.  The family live in their own home in the indigenous community of Inchatingari, in Perené district, in Chanchamayo province.

Benjamín started his life as a father when he was a teenager and still lacked a home and money.  Over time, with the support of his parents, he was able to acquire some farmland.  He formed his household and built a house.  Benjamín currently has three plots of fertile land where he produces annatto and coffee.  "With each harvest I have 1,500 kilos of annatto and 300 kilos of coffee", he says.  Benjamín sells his crops retail.  He transports his fruit to the city of Pichanaki where he has a sales stall.  There he sells his coffee and annatto by the kilo.

Benjamín has been in this business for five years.  He believes that, over the years, he will be able to expand his land and grow other crops.  He will also be able to sell wholesale as the results of this are immediate and you avoid the produce spoiling.  One of Benjamín's plans is to start buying and selling fruit which he will acquire in his town and then sell in the wholesale market in his district.  

This will be Benjamín's third loan from MFP and he pledges to be punctual in making his monthly repayments.  He says that he feels supported by his community bank 'Productores de Inchatingari' because his fellow group members share the same plans as him.  He will invest his money in buying work tools such as machetes and tool sharpeners which he will use on his coffee plantations.  He will also pay the laborers who will support him in this strenuous task.

loans.use: to buy agricultural tools and hire laborers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora, es conviviente y tiene tres hijas quienes ya son mayores y solo dos viven con ella. Tiene una casa propia en donde la comparte con dos de sus hijas y junto a su pareja, además ella tiene a su cargo un nieto de su segunda hija a quien cría y desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de zapatos, ropas y lencería, se encarga de repartir entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Lleva con éste trabajo ya casi por 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su esposo. Le gusta su trabajo ya que puede darse ese tiempo que le faltaba de estar trabajando a lado de su esposo, además de tener tiempo para poder hacer otras cosas mas en su hogar, tiene muchos planes a futuro, desea poder agrandar su negocio, traer mas variedad de productos, y en algún momento tener una tienda en donde los atienda de manera mas cómoda a sus clientes. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar con su trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, traerá productos para continuar con su negocio, entre las cosas que comprara están, zapatos, prendas de vestir y lencería de variedad en calidad y diseños.
texts.en:
Sonia, 50 years old, is a hard working, dynamic woman. She lives with her partner and has three adult daughters, two of whom live with her. She has her own house which she shares with two of her daughters and her partner. Also she looks after her grandson, the son of her second oldest daughter, who she raises and hopes to offer a better quality of life. Sonia's work consists of selling shoes, clothing and lingerie. She is responsible for distributing amongst her friends, neighbours and family members. She has worked in this activity for 22 years; it's gone well up 'til now and she has the help of her husband.

She likes her work as it gives her the time she needs to work alongside her husband and also she has time to do other things at home. She has many plans for the future; she hopes to extend her business, bring more variety of products and at some future moment to have a shop where she can serve her customers more comfortably. 

This will be her 16th loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support to continue with her work. Also, she is convinced that she will continue being a responsible member of the previous loans. She likes belonging to her communal bank as they are all responsible and very supportive. With the loan amount of 2500 PEN she will bring products to continue with her business. Among the things she will buy will be shoes, clothing and a variety of designed quality lingerie.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing and lingerie.

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie, de 22 años, es una mujer emprendedora muy joven, es soltera y aun no es madre, vive a lado de sus padres en casa de ellos, en donde también comparte junto a su hermana y su pequeño sobrino quien es la alegría de su casa. Ella trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus padres. El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa, vende sus productos en su barrio, ahí sus amigos o familiares desea tener un nuevo look, una prenda de buena marca y con diseños innovadores, siempre van en busca de los productos que ella vende, ya que encuentran novedades a buen precio y sobre todo de muy buena calidad. Lleva éste trabajo ya casi dos años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia ya que le permite tener tiempo y espacio para poder hacer sus cosas personales sin descuidar sus ingresos con los que apoya a su familia. Considera su negocio rentable porque vende sus productos a personas que tienen para pagar y sin dudar siempre le compran pues saben que tiene en venta un buen producto. Tiene muchos planes y sueños por cumplir, pero lo que por ahora desea con muchas ganas es poder tener su tienda o un local en donde exhibir y vender sus prendas. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, siempre fue muy buena socia en su banco comunal en donde la quieren mucho por que es muy responsable y solidaria, espera que le puedan brindar el préstamo que será un respaldo para ella y seguir aumentando su negocio, está convencida que seguirá siendo una socia muy puntual y pagará sus cuotas a tiempo como todos los prestamos que tuvo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mayor variedad de prendas de vestir ya que desea ofrecer mayor variedad y modelos nuevos e innovadores que es lo que le caracteriza.
texts.en:
22-year-old Steffanie is a very young entrepreneur.  She is single and not yet a mother.  She lives in her parent's home together with her parents, sister and her young nephew who fills their home with happiness.  Steffanie works hard because she would like to offer her parents a better quality of life.

Steffanie's business is selling clothing.  She sells her products in her neighborhood.  Friends or family members who would like a new look, clothing from a good brand and the latest designs seek out the products that she sells because she sells the latest, good-quality clothing at a good price.  Steffanie has been in this business for almost two years and she works alone.  What she enjoys about her work is the independence she has as it allows her to have time and space for doing her own thing without neglecting the income she needs to make to support her family.  She considers her business to be profitable because she sells her products to people who have the ability to pay and who never hesitate to buy from her as they know that she sells good products.  Steffanie has many plans and dreams to fulfill but what she would really like right now is to have her own store or a sales location where she can display and sell her clothing.

This will be Steffanie's fourth loan from MFP.  She has always been a very good member of her community bank and her fellow members all like her a lot because she is very responsible and supportive.  She hopes to receive a loan as it will be a support for her and she will be able to continue growing her business.  She is certain that she will continue being a very punctual member and will make her repayments on time like she did with her previous loans.  Steffanie will use the 1,000 soles she has requested to buy a wider variety of clothing as she would like to be able to offer a wider variety and the latest designs as this is what she is known for.

loans.use: to buy more clothing

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42, es una mujer alegre, amable y carismática, es conviviente con su pareja ya por varios años, es madre de cuatro hijos que ya son mayores. Ella vive en casa de su mamá junto a su pareja y otras seis personas más, trabaja mucho pues desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Vilma consiste en la venta de ropa, tiene los mejores diseños y la mejor calidad siempre en venta, ésta actividad lo hace en su casa y lleva ya trabajando así por casi un año. A veces espera a los clientes en su casa pero hay otras veces que sale a buscarlos entre sus vecinos y amigos. Trabaja sola pues se siente mejor estar así sin tener que rendir cuentas a nadie.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es muy descansado ya que ella ve el tiempo en el que sale a ofrecer y en que momento sale a cobrar, además tiene muy buena cartera de clientes. Tiene grandes planes a futuro, pero lo que mas le interesa es seguir creciendo, ahora está desea vender ropa de segunda y poder ofrecerlos por los diversos caseríos y comunidades de la rivera del río. Este será el quinto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en anteriores créditos que tuvo, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará prendas de vestir en mayor cantidad y diseños ya que desea tener a sus clientes siempre a la moda y eso le permite vender más rápido su mercadería.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old. She is a cheerful, kind and charismatic woman. She has lived with her spouse for several years and is the mother of four children who are already grown. She lives in her mother's house with her spouse and six other people. She works a lot because she wants to offer a better quality of life to her family. Vilma's job consists of selling clothes. She has the best designs and the best quality for sale. She does this activity in her house and has been doing it for almost a year. Sometimes she awaits her customers in her home and sometimes she seeks them out among her neighbors and friends. She works alone because she feels better not having to be accountable to anyone.

What she likes the most about her job is that it is isn't tiring since she decides when she will go out to sell and when she will collect. She also has a good clientele. She has big plans for the future, but what she's most interested in is continuing to grow. Now she wants to sell second hand clothes and offer them in different communities along the river. This will be her fifth loan with MFP, and she hopes for your cooperation in order to continue reaching her goals. Therefore she is committed once more to making her payments as she did with the previous loans she had. She is also likes being a part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive.

With the 2000 soles she has asked for, she will buy items of clothing in greater quantities and with more designs. She wants her customers to always be in style and this allows her to sell her merchandise more quickly.

loans.use: to buy more items of clothing.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Don pedro es originario de Estelí es soltero, tiene 3 hijos los cuales todos están en la escuela, de oficio comerciante. Inicio sus actividades con dinero propio que lo obtuvo trabajando en un taller de carpintería ala edad de 31 años, el vende Bolis, que son unos helados de sabores. En este negocio trabaja de manera independientes nadie lo apoya y no cuenta con otros ingreso, distribuye su productos en la pulperías de  la ciudad de Estelí este es un negocio que le ha ayudado a salir adelante ya que es un producto accesible  y popular entre los kioscos y pulperías. 

El  préstamo lo solicitó para la compra de bolsas plásticas para empaque, azúcar que es lo más necesario para realizar los bolis. Este crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio ya que podrá aumentar su materia prima y podrá cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Le gustaría comprar maquinaria más automatizada para producir más bolis y expandirse en diferentes mercados para promocionar su producto
texts.en:
Pedro is from Estelí.  He is single and has three children who are all in school.  He is a salesman.  Pedro started his business with his own money that he made working in a carpentry workshop at the age of 31.  He sells 'bolis' which are a flavored, frozen treat (a kind of ice pop frozen in a plastic bag).  He works independently in this business.  Nobody supports him and he has no other source of income.  He delivers his products to grocery stores in the city of Estelí.  This is a business which has helped him to make progress in life as it is an affordable product which is popular in kiosks and grocery stores.

Pedro requested this loan to buy plastic bags for packaging his 'bolis' and sugar which is the most important ingredient for making them.  This loan will help him to grow his business as he will be able to increase his raw materials and meet his customer demand.  He would like to buy more automated machinery for producing 'bolis' and expand into different markets to promote his product.

loans.use: to buy plastic bags and sugar

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo tiene 27 años, convive con Cecilia, de 22 años, con quien 2 hijos: Sarai de 5 y Tany de 2 años. Esta familia vive unida en una casa propia en el caserío Santa Clara, distrito de Huasahuasi. Eduardo está contento de vivir en Huasahuasi, ya que los suelos son fértiles y húmedos  propicios para sembrar papas, arvejas, habas y demás hortalizas. Eduardo es un joven agricultor, lleva en esta actividad más de 5 años. Después de cada cosecha las comercializa en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma, así obtiene ganancias considerables para mantener a su familia y seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura. Una de sus metas más deseadas es comprase terrenos para cultivar y ahorrarse el pago que realiza a otros pobladores. Además posee 4 vacas lecheras que le proporcionan la leche suficiente para hacer moldes de queso que vende en las ferias que se realizan los días jueves y domingo. En el mercado modelo de la ciudad. Así también tiene 2 toros aradores con los que realiza su trabajo y los que alquila a otros pobladores. Éste sería su crédito número 12 que obtendría de MFP. Se siente agradecido de pertenecer a un grupo sólido como lo es “Trabajemos Unidos”, los que le impulsaron a salir adelante y pensar en el futuro. Eduardo invertirá el dinero en la compra de varias bolsas de  fertilizantes naturales (guano de isla y de corral), para asegurar la buena producción de sus papas de la variedad “Única” y otra parte para sus cultivos de arvejas.
texts.en: Eduardo is 27 years old. He lives with Cecilia, who is 22. They have 2 children, Sarai, 5, and Tany, 2. This family is very close and lives in their own home in the community of Santa Clara, district of Huasahuasi. Eduardo is happy to live in Huasahuasi, since its soil is fertile and moist, perfect for growing potatoes, peas, beans and other vegetables. Eduardo is a young farmer and has done this activity for more than 5 years. After every harvest, he sells in the central market of the city of Tarma. In this way he makes considerable earnings to support his family and keep investing in agriculture. One of his biggest goals is to buy land to cultivate and not have to rent from other people. He also has five dairy cows that give him enough milk to make cheeses that he sells at the fairs on Thursdays and Sundays in the city market. He also has 2 oxen that he works with and that he rent to other residents. This is his 12th loan with MFP. He is grateful for belonging to a solid group like “Trabajemos Unidos”, which drives them to get ahead and think of the future. Eduardo will invest the money in buying various bags of natural fertilizer (island guano and manure) to ensure the good production of his "Unica" potatoes and his crop of peas.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina de 34 años hace 15 años que convive con Tomas, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad. Esta familia unida vive en una casa propia en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Marcelina se dedica a la agricultura. Desde niña prendió esta actividad ayudando a sus padres. Ahora que ya tiene familia propia también se desenvuelve en las mismas labores.
Posee 3 lotes de terrenos en los que siembra café. “Cada año cosechó de 60 sacos a más, depende del abono que se le eche”, dice. El café es el producto que vende con éxito en los meses de cosecha (de abril a junio), además siembra plátanos y yucas pero son para su consumo.
Por su parte, Tomas trabaja en un aserradero, hace 2 años. Ahí recibe un sueldo fijo.
De esa manera pueden mantener a sus hijos y aspirar a una calidad de vida mejor. Marcelina piensa ampliar sus cultivos de café, para ello deberá limpiar sus terrenos para iniciar nuevas plantaciones. La inversión es fuerte ya adquirirá plantitas de café y bolsas de abonos. Marcelina accedería a su crédito número 8 de MFP. Al igual que en los ciclos anteriores, menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Siente identificación y satisfacción de pertenecer a su banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”, por el trabajo en equipo.
Destinará el dinero en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos, para iniciar una siembra de café en 2 lotes de terrenos, además comprará 15 mil plantitas de café.
texts.en:
34-year-old Marcelina has been living with her partner Tomas for 15 years.  They have two children who are 14 and 12 years old.  This united family live in their own home in San Juan Centro Autiki, in Pichanaki district, in Chanchamayo province.

Marcelina's business is farming.  She has been in this line of work since she was a girl helping her parents.  Now that she has her own family, she carries out the same work.  Marcelina owns three plots of land where she grows coffee.  "Every year I harvest 60 sacks, depending on the fertilizer I use", she says.  Coffee is a product that sells successfully during harvest months (from April to June).  Marcelina also grows bananas and cassava but they are for her own consumption.  Tomas, for his part, has been working in a sawmill for two years.  He receives a fixed salary.  In this way, the couple are able to provide for their children and aspire to a better quality of life.  Marcelina plans to expand her coffee plantings but she must weed her land before she can start planting new crops.  The investment is high.  She will acquire coffee plants and bags of fertilizer.

This will be Marcelina's eighth loan from MFP.  She says that she will be punctual in making her repayments as she was with her previous loans.  She feels happy to be a member of her community bank (Flor de San Juan) where she has a sense of belonging.  She likes it because of the team work.  Marcelina will use her money to pay laborers who she will hire to weed her crops so that she can start sowing coffee on two plots of land.  She will also buy 15,000 coffee seedlings.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy 15,000 coffee seedlings

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 30-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has one child, age 6, who goes to school. 

Stella runs a mixed goods store and he has been in the business for three years. He has no employees. Stella heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done in the market by the loans officers.  He is taking a loan of 2,000 SDG to purchase more items such as Nomi, Hair comps, clothing, and many other things. Stella has no other source of income aside from this business.

In five years time, Stella hopes to increase the size of his business by increasing the number of products he stocks.  His major challenge is a low income. Stella says that he really appreciates Finance South Sudan for good work they do, which should not end.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as Nomi, Hair comps, clothing, and many other things.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 40 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  He is married to Milka who is also a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which he uses to support his family.

John is applying for his third loan after repaying the previous loans successfully.  He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business John will educate his children. His hopes for the future are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 39 years old and a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Henry, a business man. They are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.

Julia is applying for her fourth loan from  KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hope is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 57-year-old married woman. She has two sons and two daughters. Her husband works outside the city.

Hanan chose to start a small home-based retail business, selling antiques and toys to cover some of the daily expenses. 

She has applied for a loan to increase her inventory of toys and add new types of goods to sell.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of toys and add new types of goods to sell.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a 49-year-old married woman. Her husband is a school bus driver. They have nine sons and daughters.

To be able to support the family, Mona chose to start an embroidery business to help her husband, so she started embroidering clothes, sheets and other items. She sells them from home.
 
She has applied for a loan to buy more threads and fabric to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more threads and fabric.

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is a 33-year-old business man who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 9 years of age.  Two of them go to school. 

Awad runs a mixed goods store, and he has been in this business for two years. He has no employees. Awad heard about Finance Sudan through a promotion done in the market by the loans officers.  He is taking a loan of SDG 1,200 to purchase more items such as Nomi, Dry cells, saddles, and many other things. Awad has no other source of income aside from this business.

In five years time, Awad would like to have a better business with many products.  His major challenge is a low income. Awad says that he really appreciates Finance South Sudan for bringing him this opportunity and he is happy about that.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as Nomi, Dry cells, saddles, and many other things.

loans.name: Korpo K.

texts.en:
Korpo, who lives in Air Port, is 32 years of age, married, and the mother of two children, ages 5 and 10, both in school. Her husband is a driver, while Korpo, who received money from her husband to start her business, operates a food market.

She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter boil, and okra for her business, and plans to enable her children to continue in school and build a house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter boil, and okra for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 28 years old and lives in Airport.  She is a high school graduate, single, and has a 7-year-old child who lives at home and goes to school. For the past three years, she been selling rubber dishes and slippers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes for her business. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers and rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila de 30 años hace 10 años convive con Ronald, el padre de sus 2 hijas: Leticia de 9 y Yadira de 5 años de edad. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, Chanchamayo. Lucila es una mujer organizada. Su hogar y familia reflejan su sobresaliente valor. Cuenta con un negocio en su propia casa, “tengo una tienda de abarrotes, ahí vendo de todo, hace 1 año”, menciona, añadiendo que le va muy bien. 
Además se dedica a la agricultura. Posee 3 parcelas de terrenos donde produce plátano y un poco de café.  Obteniendo de 15 a 20 sacos de café seco. Es consiente que este trabajo es cansado y absorbente, por eso Ronald se encuentra en el campo mayormente y Rosa tiene que cerrar su negocio para atender sus cultivos.
Lucila distribuye bien su tiempo, para sus hijos, su hogar, su negocio y sus cultivos. Gracias a ese esfuerzo puede estar segura que sus ingresos económicos solventarán sus necesidades básicas.
Le gusta realizar estas actividades por eso continuará con sus labores agrícolas. Ahora piensa ampliar más sus sembríos de café, por ello deberá invertir en plantas y abonos. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. “Flor de San Juan” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente contenta de pertenecer a un grupo sólido y participativo. Con el dinero podrá abastecer la mercadería para su negocio, también podrá pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para hacer la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
30-year-old Lucila has been living with her partner Ronald for 10 years.  He is the father of her two children: 9-year-old Leticia and 5-year-old Yadira.  The family live together in their own home in San Juan Centro Autiki, in Pichanaki district, in Chachamayo province.  Lucila is an organized woman.  Her house and her family reflect this outstanding virtue.  She has a business in her own home.  "I have a grocery store where I sell a bit of everything.  I have had it for one year", she comments, adding that it is doing very well.

Lucila is also a farmer.  She has three plots of land where she grows bananas and a little coffee.  She obtains 15 to 20 sacks of coffee beans.  She is aware that this work is tiring and time-consuming.  For this reason, Ronald works mainly in the fields and Rosa has to close her business to attend to her crops.  Lucila divides her time carefully between her children, her household, her business and her crops.  Thanks to her efforts, she is able to ensure that her income covers her basic needs.  She enjoys her work and, for that reason, she will continue carrying out her agricultural work.  Lucila is now planning to further expand her coffee plantings and will need to invest in plants and fertilizers.

This will be Lucila's eighth loan from MFP and she gives her word that she will be punctual in making her repayments.  'Flor de San Juan' is the name of her community bank.  She feels happy to belong to such a solid and active group.  She will use her money to stock up with merchandise for her business.  She will also be able to pay the laborers who she will hire to weed her crops.

loans.use: to hire laborers and buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Nesfat

texts.en:
Nesfat is a 60-year-old hardworking man. He has two daughters and a son.

Nesfat opened a clothes shop two years ago in an active area. During these two years he has been able to add more and more goods to the store. 

Now he has applied for a loan to update his inventory with new fashionable clothes that go with the fashion these days.

loans.use: to buy new fashionable clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra is a 48-year-old married woman. Her husband works in making blocks for building. She has two married sons and three other single children.

Yusra buys and sells blankets and clothes to help her husband in supporting the family and covering their monthly expenses. 

She has applied for a loan to increase her inventory and thus to increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three daughters and a son. 

Hanan works in a youth center, and her husband works for the government..

Besides her job, Hanan owns a number of sheep that she raises and takes care of to sell. Now Hanan has applied for a loan to buy food for the sheep and to buy more sheep.

loans.use: to buy food for the sheep and to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline, who lives in Air Port, is 33 years old, married, and the mother of  three children between the ages of  2 and 11, the two oldest in school. For five years Roseline has been selling rubbers dishes, and she is now requesting a loan to purchase  more. Her plan is to build her house.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 28 years old and lives in Airport.  She is single and has three children between the ages of 3 months and 12 years. Two of her children are in school and live at home. 

She has been selling rubber dishes for three years now.  She started her business at the time she was working as a cook. She used six months of her salary for her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rubber dishes for her business.  Her plans are to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase rubber dishes for her business.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in Airport.  She is 28 years old, single, and has two children, ages 5 and 7. They are in school and live at home.

For the past four years, Winnie has been selling rice, oil, pepper, onions, and bitter ball. One problem she is facing is the rainy season. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, bitter ball, pepper, and onions for her business. Her future plans are to send her children to school and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, bitter ball, pepper, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Floviance

texts.en: Floviance, a 26-year-old married mother of one, sells used sweaters, blouses and trousers to earn a living. In business for two years, she employs one person. Since joining Faulu Kenya, Floviance has been able to save her income, and she hopes to expand her business in the future. She is now requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings to buy more used sweaters, blouses and trousers to sell.

loans.use: to buy used sweaters, blouses and trousers to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a businessman. He sells milk to earn a living. He has been in this business for one year. He describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, David has been able to save his income. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES to buy milk to sell.

loans.use: To buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married with three children. He runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to expand his business. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa de 35 años es una madre soltera de 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años. Ella vive contenta con sus 2 hijos en una casa propia ubicada en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Los campos de cultivo de su localidad son propicios para la siembra de diversos frutos, por eso Rosa se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra café y plátanos en sus 4 parcelas de tierras fértiles.
“Tengo 4 lotes, 3 que producen entre café y plátanos; y otra parcela, ahí recién sembré café”, menciona. Rosa tendrá que esperar 3 años como mínimo para ver brotar los primeros granos del café.
Ella no se siente sola. Sus hijos la apoyan en todo momento en el trabajo duro. Pero la temporada de cosecha requiere más esfuerzo, por eso contrata a jornaleros para agilizar esta labor. 
Hace 5 años, tenía ciertos inconvenientes, que en su mayoría era la falta de capital. Ahora puede contar con apoyo económico de MFP. Menciona sentirse respaldada. De esa manera continuará con su trabajo, ahorrando e invirtiendo en la agricultura. Rosa accedería a su crédito número 8 de MFP, gracias a su ayuda. Por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Flor de San Juan” es el nombre de su banco comunal. Se siente cómoda te tener como compañeros a personas solidarias. Rosa invertiría los 600 soles que solicita en el pago de los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus 3 parcelas de cultivos que se encuentran cubiertos de malezas. Ella paga 30 soles al día.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 35, is the single mother of two children, ages 18 and 12.  She lives contentedly with her two children in her own house in the town of San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province.

The farmland in her area is favorable for growing different fruits.  Therefore, Rosa dedicates herself to farming.  She grows coffee and bananas on her four parcels of fertile land.  “I have four lots; three of them produce café and or bananas.  On the other lot I have recently planted coffee,” she says.  Rosa will have to wait three years minimum to see the first coffee beans sprout.

She does not feel alone.  Her children support her at every moment with the hard work.  However, during the harvesting season she needs extra effort.  She hires day workers to expedite the work.

Five years ago she had certain obstacles, which was mostly the lack of capital.  Now she is able to count on financial support with MFP.  She says that she feels supported.  This is the way she will continue with her work, saving and investing in farming.

This will be Rosa’s eighth loan with MFP, thanks to your help.  She pledges to be punctual with her monthly payments.  

Flor de San Juan is the name of her communal bank.  She feels comfortable to have supportive people as her colleagues.  Rosa will use the requested 600 soles to pay day workers.  She will hire them to clear the weeds from three parcels of crops that are coverd with weeds.  She pays 30 soles per day.

loans.use: to hire day workers.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 43 years old, is a married man who has five sons and daughters.

Mohammad has his own fruit and vegetable stall that he wants to improve and expand. He has applied for a loan to buy more fruit and vegetables. He also want to start another business selling electronics.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph has managed a retail shop for the past nine years. He has applied for his forth loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk for sale.

He hopes to boost his business and get a good harvest in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and cooking fat in bulk.

loans.name: Gereshon

texts.en:
Gereshon, age 36, has a polythene bag sales business. He has been engaged in this business for the past nine months. He and his wife have three children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

Gereshon has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, which will enable him add stock of bags to offer for sale. He was introduced to KADET by one of our staff.

He hopes to see his business grow to great heights in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 57-year-old married man. He has eight children between the ages of 8 and 28 years. He lives in Hudaidah,Yemen. He describes himself as competent and ambitious. He operates a retail business, providing and selling spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 13 years thus has enough experience to attract loyal customers & to expand his business. His business is located in an area conducive to his service; his primary customers are mechanics. His biggest business challenge is the high price of spare parts. He works hard to improve his business in order to provide his family with good and healthy living conditions.

Nasser applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy more spare parts for his business. Nasser`s business dream and goal is to run big mechanic workshop in addition to his recent business.

loans.use: buy more spare parts for his business.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old married man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has a mill ("tahoun") and has been involved in purchasing grains then selling them to his customers after milling. He started his business because it has fast sales in the market and is attractive to business partners. He works at the business from 7:00 am until 7:30 pm, 7 days per week. He is an incredibly hard-working man and as a result has a lot of experience. In addition, it is the only main source of his income. On the other hand, through lots of effort, he has managed to grind his customer`s grain, i.e., he provides them a service to put food on the table. Recently, he says that the main challenge to his business is a seasonal problem: during the dry season this type of product is very expensive.

So, Mohammed took out a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grain for his business. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to improve his standard of living. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to have a extra mill store because his region is lacking some services which he could supply to solve people's needs.

loans.use: to purchase grain for his milling business so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah is a 42-year-old married woman from Al Zarqa, Amman, Jordan.

Kefah has a home-based project. She started her business through selling clothes door-to-door then she started making handmade embroidery.

Kefah is requesting a loan of 500 JD to enlarge her project by purchasing raw materials needed. She is looking to establish a small workshop for making embroidery.

loans.use: to enlarge her project by purchasing raw materials needed

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 45-year-old businessman who is married to Beth, a farmer. They are blessed with two children. He has been working a crafts business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a staff member. Martin will use the loan to buy crafts for sale. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, Martin will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: to buy crafts for sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has operated her beauty salon in Nakuru for the last nine years. She is 38 years old and married to Job. They have been blessed with three children.

Rose was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy another hair dryer for use in her business. This will also enable her to serve and sustain her customers well.

In the future, Rose hopes to grow her business and own another beauty salon in Nakuru. This will enable her to make more money and buy a plot of land on which to construct a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy another hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, age 49, practices mixed crop farming. He and his wife Elizabeth, also a farmer, are blessed with three children. He has been in a farming business for the past 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family.
 
He is applying for his third loan after repaying the previous loans successfully. Edward will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will ensure the education of his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Khaleel

texts.en:
Khaleel is a 35-year-old married man from Hay Nazal, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child.

Khaleel has a kids' toys and clothes shop and he is requesting a loan of 2000 JD to purchase more kids' toys and clothes for business purposes.

Khaleel is looking to open another branch for his shop and purchase new furniture for his house with an aspiration of improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase kids' toys and clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a conservative person thus she is unwilling to upload her picture on the internet. The man in the photo is her husband, Ghaleb.

Manal is a 37-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of three children.

Manal sells birds and she is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase more birds so that she can expand her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase birds for business purposes

loans.name: Manwah

texts.en:
Manwah is a 59-year-old divorced woman from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a mother of two children.

Manwah has a beauty salon and she is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase a comfortable chair for her salon and some other equipment.

Manwah is looking to improve her family's living conditions in addition to paying the remaining installments for her house

loans.use: to purchase a comfortable chair for her salon and some other equipment

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is 37 years old, a married man who has six children and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has six years of experience in tailoring then selling men's clothing. He is able to choose appropriate merchandise because he has good taste. 

He chose this business because it is very profitable and he has gained permanent clients over the years. He is friendly, polite and always gives a discount. He lives in a rented house which is expensive. He says the secret of his success is his shop's location, in the central bazaar. 

Ahmed`s monthly income is not enough to cover his family's needs so he has applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase men's fabrics in order to stitch trousers and shirts. He will use this loan to purchase new merchandise and diversify. 

In the future, Ahmed would like to open branches of tailoring shops in all provinces of his country as well as have a house of his own.

loans.use: to purchase men's fabrics in order to stitch trousers and shirts for his business.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is in his mid-40s and married with three children, two of whom go to school. Since 2006, he has been selling sand and stone and running a quarry. Mohamed works from seven in the morning through five in the afternoon daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. He will share his loan with his loan group, "Uwezesho," which has 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

Mohamed is requesting his ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He will use his loan to buy one lorry of sand and stone to sell. Mohamed used his previous loans to buy land and pay household expenses. He has successfully repaid his previous loans.

loans.use: to buy sand and stone to sell

loans.name: Pathé

texts.fr:
Monsieur Pathé est un jeune commerçant qui a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale dans son quartier.  Il a une expérience de 8 ans dans ce domaine. Pathé est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. C’est un habitué du guichet car il a déjà eu à bénéficier de 3 crédits pour renforcer son activité. Etant dans une zone très fréquentée, il a l’opportunité de fructifier son commerce car il y a une forte demande.  
Avec le crédit, il va acheter les denrées les plus rapides à écouler comme le sucre, le lait, le thé, le savon... 
Malgré son jeune âge, Pathé s’est très tôt responsabilisé dans la gestion de la dépense quotidienne. C’est lui qui se charge de la nourriture ; il s’occupe aussi des frais de scolarité de ses enfants, mais réussi tout de même à mettre de l’argent de coté. Dans l’avenir il voudrait agrandir sa boutique avec l’appui des preteurs.
texts.en:
Mr. Pathé is a young merchant who opened a general food store in his neighborhood. He has eight years of experience in this field. He's 35 years old, married, and the father of two children.

He's a regular at the MFI's local branch, since he already benefited from three loans to strengthen his business. Being located in a busy area, he is able to bolster his business since the demand is high.

With this loan, he will buy food products that sell the fastest, such as sugar, milk, tea, soap, etc. Early on, in spite of his young age, Pathé became responsible for handling the daily expenses.

He's in charge for the food, and also covers his children's school expenses. He nevertheless manages to put money away. In the future, he would like to expand his store with the support of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, tea, cooking oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga de 50 años está casada con Fortunato, el padre de sus 6 hijos, pero sólo vive con 4 de ellos, cuyas edades oscilan entre los 19 y 9 años de edad. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el centro poblado San Juan Centro Autiki, distrito de Pichanaki, provincia de Chanchamayo. Desde niña, Olga se dedica a la agricultura. Ella nació rodeada de cultivos que sus padres producían. Así aprendió sobre esta actividad. Ahora que es una madre y mujer casada tiene 10 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas, pero solo produce en 4.  “Siembro 3 lotes de café para el negocio, los plátanos y yucas solo es para el consumo de mi familia”, dice. La venta de café abastece para mantener a su hogar. Cada cosecha obtiene 20 sacos de café, los que vende a buen precio en la ciudad de Pichanaki. Los compradores frecuentan el mercado mayorista en los meses de mayo a julio (meses de cosechas).
Por su parte, Fortunato, trabaja como operario o jornalero en otros cultivos. Y cuando ella termina de hacer sus tareas del hogar, se dirige hacia sus cultivos para apoyar a su esposo. El trabajo es coordinado por eso sus ganancias son la mejor retribución para su esfuerzo. Éste sería su crédito número 8 que obtendría de MFP, por eso da su palabra de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Afirma sentirse satisfecho con su banco comunal “Flor de San Juan”, por el trabajo en equipo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de machetes nuevos y en el pago a los jornaleros quienes limpiarán sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Olga, age 50, is married to Fortunato, the father of their six children.  They only live with four of the children, whose ages range from 19-9.  This family lives in their own house in the town of San Juan Centro Autiki in the Pichanaki district, Chanchamayo province.

Olga has devoted herself to agriculture since she was a young girl.  Now that she is a mother and married, she has ten parcels of farmland.  She only produces on four of them.  “I plant three lots of coffee for the business.  The bananas and yuccas are only for my family’s consumption,” she says.

The sale of coffee provides support for her household.  Each harvest produces 20 sacks of coffee that she sells for a good price in the city of Pichanaki.  The buyers frequent the wholesale market in the months of May through July (harvest months).

In turn, Fortunato works as an operator or day worker on other crops.  When she finishes her housework, she heads towards her crops to support her husband.  The work is coordinated, and the earnings are the best reward for her effort.

This will be her eighth loan with MFP.  She gives her word to punctually make her monthly payments.  She affirms that she is happy with her communal bank, Flor de San Juan, for the teamwork.

She will use the loan to buy new machetes and to pay the day workers who will clear the weeds from her coffee crops.

loans.use: to buy machetes and to hire day workers.

loans.name: Fawziah Group

texts.en:
FAWZIAH Group is made up of four people, Fawziah, Sumiah, Wafa and Haifa, who live in the same neighborhood in Sana`a, Yemen. They requested a loan of 120,000  YER as financial support  with the aim of increasing their business.

Fawziah is 38 years old, a married woman with four children, all of them in school. She lives with her husband and children in Sana`a. She has been operating an incense sales business for two years. (She is the second woman from the right,  holding a box of  incense in her hand).

This business allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She says the main challenges faced are high school fees for her children. 

In the hope of better responding to customer demand, she would like to build up her product stock and enhance her business activity. In order to do so, Fawziah requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy more incense for resale. 

The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing payment of school fees. In the future, Fawziah plans to develop her business into a clothing shop.

loans.use: to buy more incense for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 37-year-old business lady. She is married to John, a businessman. They are blessed with three children. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past five years and earns a monthly income of KES 18,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Jane will use the loan to buy a stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 35-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children. She has been running a boutique shop for the past three years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Regina will use the loan to buy a stock of new clothes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a big boutique shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Chun

texts.en:
This is Chun, a humble villager who resides in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a widow and a mother who is responsible for two children. Both of her children are married. Chun earns her livelihood by as a rice farmer. She has been a rice farmer for over 30 years, and has provided her family with a suitable income. 

Chun is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase a stock of rice from local villagers. This will improve her living standard and provide enough food for her entire family through the year. Chun has already received four previous loans from her MFI but this is her first loan with a Kiva partner. Chun is an honest client who always pays her loans back on time and follows her schedule.

loans.use: to purchase rice from local villagers

loans.name: Mt Uluguru Group

texts.en:
Seven is single and in his mid-20s. For the past three years, he has been running two businesses: a motorcycle transport business and a vegetable stall. Seven works daily from seven in the morning through six thirty at night and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

Seven is requesting his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, to start building his own house.  His dream is to one day be able to finish building his house. Seven will share this loan with his loan group, "Mt Uluguru," which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to start building his own house

loans.name: Bula Group

texts.en:
The borrower, who is in her early 60's, is married with four children, three of them are grown up and one is at the university. She has had a poultry business for 10 years now. She works from 6:00 am to 7:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more chicks. Her dream is to one day be able to build herself another house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "bula" which has a total of 22 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Lem

texts.en:
Lem is 43 years old, living in Batey district of Kompong Cham province. She has a common law relationship with her spouse for over 20 years and has been blessed with five children; four are single and one is married. Lem has devoted her life time dedicated to rice husbandry, the only business she can generate her livelihood from. Her spouse is also in the same type of business. They work very hard to provide their children a good education, so they may have good jobs in the future.

For this time with her first cycle loan with HKL and Kiva, Lem will use the loan to buy fertilizers to put in her soil to keep her crops in good condition and thereby increase the output of rice. Lem wishes to expand this business in the following years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to put in her soil.

loans.name: Achieng

texts.en:
Achieng lives in Bor. She sells fish, and has been in business for three years. She is 39 year old, married, and has three children; two of them are still in school. 

Achieng heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.
